Name: Additional Character Names
Author: DarthParametric
About: Adds additional random names for the RT and mercenaries in the character creator.

VersionHistory.Changelog:
Adds additional random names for the RT and mercenaries in the character creator.

Requires MicroPatches v1.17.0+.

* Initial release

Description:
# Additional Character Names
A mod for Owlcat's Rogue Trader cRPG. Adds additional random names for the RT and mercenaries in the character creator.

## Overview
This mod expands the available pool of randomly generated names in the character creator. By default, the game splits the available names into two pools: one for the player character and one for mercenaries, resulting in only 30 available names for each sex in each pool. This mod joins both pools together and then adds a slew of additional names taken from a list [provided by Fantasy Flight](https://www.fantasyflightgames.com/ffg_content/rogue-trader-col-ed/Official-RT-names.pdf) as supplemental material for the original tabletop RT. After removing duplicates and common/unsuitable/uninteresting entries, this results in around 300 names for males and 125 for females.

## Installation
This is an Owlmod, made using the Unity template supplied by Owlcat. Currently the game has a bug that prevents Owlmods from working. To fix this, you ***must*** install the Unity Mod Manager-based mod [MicroPatches](https://github.com/microsoftenator2022/MicroPatches/releases) by microsoftenator2022. You can install it manually or via [ModFinder](https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/146).

To install this mod, first make sure you have run the game at least once. Download the archive and extract it into:

%LocalAppData%Low\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\Modifications\
Each Owlmod needs to be in its own sub-folder in the Modifications folder.

Afterwards, you need to edit OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json in the base Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader folder in a text editor (Notepad++ recommended). It should look something like this:

```
{
"$id": "1",
"SourceDirectories": [],
"EnabledModifications": ["DPAdditionalCharacterNames"],
"ActiveModifications": ["DPAdditionalCharacterNames"],
"DisabledModifications": []
}
```

If you have other mods, list them in quotes separated by commas. For example:

```
"EnabledModifications": ["DPAdditionalCharacterNames", "ModName2", "ModName3"],
"ActiveModifications": ["DPAdditionalCharacterNames", "ModName2", "ModName3"],
```

You can move individual mods from the ActiveModifications section to the DisabledModifications section if you want to disable them without physically removing them.

Alternatively, use [ModFinder](https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/146) to install the mod.

It should be fine to install the mod in an existing game at any point, although obviously it's primarily intended for new games.

## Known Issues
This mod replaces the vanilla localisation strings for player/merc character names. As such, it is not compatible with any other mod that also replaces the same strings. GUIDs: `62681797-7835-4b5c-b8dd-63918881b28a` / `d109f177-8a63-40eb-8a51-dcd29d3eb94e` / `29e96169-b891-43ef-8b01-bf821656e4d7` / `566bb5f9-4e93-448a-b654-b9c2f2dc3efb`.

Currently the mod only replaces the names for the English localisation. Other languages will continue to use the vanilla set of names. If anyone wants to contribute localised versions in another language, let me know.

## Acknowledgements
Many thanks to the modders on the Owlcat Dicord, but particularly microsoftenator2022 and Kurufinve.

Description:
#  Adepta Sororitas Sabbat-Pattern Helmets
A mod for Owlcat's Rogue Trader cRPG. Adds several Sabbat-pattern helmets for Argenta (or mod-added Sororitas background RTs) throughout the game.

## Overview
This mod adds the familiar Sabbat-pattern helmet employed by the Adepta Sororitas. Owlcat did initially showcase Argenta wearing one in the pre-release trailers, but for whatever reason this was removed and no longer exists in the game files. This is a new model made by me (although a hooded version uses one of Owlcat's hood models).

The mod contains four helmets. The first two - the standard base version and a hooded Celestian version - are available in chapters 2 and 4, respectively, via the Drusian vendor. The remaining two are paired with Argenta's mutually exclusive quest armours, available at the end of chapter 4. Additionally, this mod makes a minor tweak to the final cutscene/conversation of this quest to ensure that Argenta actually equips the armour she gains.

## Installation
This is an Owlmod, made using the Unity template supplied by Owlcat. Currently the game has a bug that prevents Owlmods from working. To fix this, you ***must*** install the Unity Mod Manager-based mod [MicroPatches](https://github.com/microsoftenator2022/MicroPatches/releases) by microsoftenator2022. You can install it manually or via [ModFinder](https://github.com/CasDragon/ModFinder/releases/latest).

To install this mod, first make sure you have run the game at least once. Download the archive and extract it into:

%LocalAppData%Low\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\Modifications\
Each Owlmod needs to be in its own sub-folder in the Modifications folder.

Afterwards, you need to edit OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json in the base Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader folder in a text editor (Notepad++ recommended). It should look something like this:

```
{
"$id": "1",
"SourceDirectories": [],
"EnabledModifications": ["DPAdeptaSororitasSabbatHelmet"],
"ActiveModifications": ["DPAdeptaSororitasSabbatHelmet"],
"DisabledModifications": []
}
```

If you have other mods, list them in quotes separated by commas. For example:

```
"EnabledModifications": ["DPAdeptaSororitasSabbatHelmet", "ModName2", "ModName3"],
"ActiveModifications": ["DPAdeptaSororitasSabbatHelmet", "ModName2", "ModName3"],
```

You can move individual mods from the ActiveModifications section to the DisabledModifications section if you want to disable them without physically removing them.

Alternatively, use [ModFinder](https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/146) to install the mod.

It should be fine to install the mod in an existing game at any point right up to completing Argenta's quest in chapter 4 (or after if you're willing to use Toybox to manually spawn the helmets).

## Known Issues
Additional localisation support has been added for non-English languages, but these have mostly been machine translated aside from those noted below. Expect errors and terrible/nonsensical grammar.

There will be some log spam after the final cutscene of Argenta's personal quest (although the vanilla version also has a bunch of error logs) seemingly due to the game trying to equip Argenta before she has rejoined the party. I did try tweaking the scene to prevent this but to no avail. Despite the error logs, everything seems to work fine. She will be wearing the armour and associated helmet for the path she's on when she returns to you (check the images tab for a screenshot).

The mod will be incompatible with any other mod that edits the CommandAction9 and CommandAction10 blueprints for the Argenta_Q2_ArgentaReturn_KTC cutscene. It's an unfortunate limitation of the way Owlmod blueprint patches work. It will probably also break (at least until I update it) if Owlcat patch those blueprints or otherwise alter the scene at some point to fix the vanilla bug.

This mod creates a save dependency! You won't be able to load a save that used it if you later uninstall the mod.

## Acknowledgements
Many thanks to the modders on the Owlcat Dicord, but particularly microsoftenator2022 and Kurufinve, for helping to coach me through my ineptitude in order to get the mod working.

Chinese localisation kindly supplied by Komoechan.

Name: Administratum Sage Origin
Author: jonHinkerton
About: Adds a human computer background to the game

VersionHistory.Changelog: Added Russian localization
Multiplier fix to class ability
Added origin reactivity to prologue and conviction reactivity throughout.

Description:
Thinking machines, or abominable intelligences, have long been banned in the Imperium. While machine spirits are able to fill many tasks for which such beasts were required, the act of processing, analyzing, and synthesizing large amounts of data is beyond the ability of a mere machine. To fill this role, humanity instead employs sages, individuals of great intellect trained to use their minds in powerful new ways which allow them to store vast amounts of data in compartmentalized segments and to use that data to make predictions and determinations which no lesser intelligence would be capable.

The Sage uses their superior intellect to predict the flow of events around them, staying a step ahead of their adversaries.

The Sage's active ability, Threat Analysis, lets them add their intelligence to their critical hit chance several times per combat.

The sage also has 5 talents available during level-up:
[list]
[*]Calculated Risk: dodge is based on intelligence rather than agility.
[*]Closed mind: the sage is immune to distracted and perplexed.
[*]Quick Thinking: The Sage adds their intelligence bonus to their initiative roll.
[*]Sound Arguments: The Sage may use their intelligence bonus in place of fellowship bonus.
[*]Supercomputing: Any time the Sage begins a turn with an Intelligence bonus of 10 or more, they gain +1 AP.
[/list]

[b]Installation:[/b]

You will need to install [url=https://github.com/microsoftenator2022/MicroPatches]MicroPatches[/url] [b]version 1.17.4+[/b] for this mod to work.

The easiest way to install it would be to use [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/146]Modfinder[/url]﻿.

If not using ModFinder, you will need to unzip the folder into your Game's Modifications folder. The path will be similar to C:\Users\Me\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\Modifications

Once the folder is there, you may need to edit your OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json file. This is one level up from the mod's folder. It needs to look something like:

[code]﻿{"$id":"1","SourceDirectories":[],"EnabledModifications":["jhSage","BigFlagship","jhExpandedArchetypes"],"ActiveModifications":["jhSage","jhExpandedArchetypes"],"DisabledModifications":[]}
[/code]
You will need to add the two entries for jhSage following the format above. Once this file is edited you can start your game and you should see the mod in the in-game mod tool (not the built in Unity Mod Manager)

Name: Allow Modded Achievements
Author: AlterAsc
About: Separate mod to allow achievements while modded.

VersionHistory.Changelog: updated for game version 1.0.97
Initial release

Description:
# Allow Modded Achievements mod for Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader

Separate mod to allow achievements while modded.

If you use Toy Box checkbox you don't need it.    

If you install both this and Toy Box, this mod applies regardless of Toy Box checkbox state.

## Installation
1. Unpack archive directly into `%userprofile%\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\UnityModManager\` WITHOUT creating additional archive named folder.
2. After running the game, navigate to UMM mod settings (press Ctrl-F10) and set settings as you need.

Resulting structure of already existing UnityModManager folder should be as follows
- `AllowModdedAchievements` (folder)
	- `AllowModdedAchievements.dll`
	- `Info.info`
	- `OwlcatModificationManifest.json`

## How to build (for developers only)
1. Set up RoguePath environment variable to point to game folder
2. Restore nuget packages
3. Clean Solution.
4. Build (note that on build output is automatically copied to installation path).


## Credits
To Xenofell for making "Allow Modded Achievements" for Pathfinder: Wrath of the Righteous
To Petirep for creating image meme used for thumbnail

Name: Arc Rifles As Plasma
Author: jonHinkerton
About: Makes arc rifles members of the plasma family so that mechanicus/forge world characters can make the most of these distinctively admech weapons.
Description:
The most Mechanicus guns in the game really aren't the best choice for characters with the most reason to use them. Forge World characters and Pasqal are well-suited to plasma and melta types, but the arc rifle has long languished in the exotic family. This change sees to it that they too are the pinnacle of weaponry.

[/code]

Name: Assassin Buffs
Author: Mawootad
About: Provides small buffs for the Assassin to make them scale better. Assassin as a class mostly has a clear and functional role but has numbers that are too low to fulfill the job of a pure damage dealer. This mod provides some small tweaks that improve how the Assassin's key abilities function.
Description:
Provides small buffs for the Assassin to make them scale better. Assassin as a class mostly has a clear and functional role but has numbers that are too low to fulfill the job of a pure damage dealer. This mod provides some small tweaks that improve how the Assassin's key abilities function:

[list]
[*]Openings: Are applied on extra turns. Damage cap 300 -> 200 + 2 x lethality.
[*]Killing Edge: Added damage is now base damage instead of non-scaling damage, benefiting from crit and other multipliers. Scaling lethality / 5 -> lethality / 10.
[*]Death Whisper: No longer reduces the damage dealt by openings
[/list]
In a later version, Assassin will be able to move after attacking. If you would like to add that functionality now you can add the Assassin_IntoTheShadows_Feature feature to your assassin via ToyBox.

Source code: https://github.com/Mawootad/AssassinBuffs

If you would like localizations in a different language please feel free to submit a pull request or feel free to post a list of the translations you think are appropriate for the strings in https://github.com/Mawootad/AssassinBuffs/blob/main/Localization/enGB.json and I can add them and credit you.

Name: Banters Diversity
Author: juliabel
About: Banters for the Banter God! Ð‘Ð¾Ð»ÑŒÑˆÐµ Ð±Ð°Ð½Ñ‚ÐµÑ€Ð¾Ð² Ð‘Ð¾Ð³Ñƒ Ð‘Ð°Ð½Ñ‚ÐµÑ€Ð¾Ð²!

VersionHistory.Changelog: Tweaked new banters, added more reusable points for banters. See Update1 in Optional files section.
Updated for 1.4 patch and DLC. Please, update MicroPatches mod to latest version (1.18) too!
Lowered reactivity banters priority in 1st chapter to align with other banters.
Initial release

Description:
Banters for the Banter God!
1. All banters are played with a mandatory response.
2. Where previously only banters tied to locations were played, banters about the relationships of party members and story-related reactions will now also appear.
3. New places where banters are played have been added (Footfall, story locations, DLC locations - wherever it was possible to add them).
4. A bonus for those who want to hear the maximum: reusable points. Until the mechanisms associated with them are fulfilled, the points work at each character/companion enter. The first pair is on the ship, in the voidship shrine (DLC location "Shadows of the Void"), part of the Furia mace puzzle, and here you can listen to all the banters of relationships and story reactions (you can return in every chapter, except for those played in Commorragh). The second pair is in Commorragh, in the Reaving Tempest Spire, right after entering the 2nd floor, and here you can listen to the banters of relationships and reactions to the events of Commorragh. See screenshots of the exact locations in the screenshots section.
Attention: after Furia puzzle completion (or turning off traps in Spire) banter points will stop working too. So if you want to listen, just run back and forth between plates. 
5. And a new bonus for those who want to hear the maximum: some map points ("loops") now also play banters when clicked. See screenshots of the exact locations in the screenshots section, description - in Update1.

Attention! Gaining achievements will be blocked when using mods. To unlock this function use mod [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/1]Toy Box[/url] and check the feature "Allow Achievments While Using Mod" (first page, section ﻿Quality of Life).

Больше бантеров Богу Бантеров! 
1. Все бантеры проигрываются с обязательным ответом.
2. Там, где ранее проигрывались только бантеры, привязанные к локациям, теперь будут появляться также бантеры о взаимоотношениях сопартийцев, и реакции на сюжет.
3. Добавлены новые места, где проигрываются бантеры (Футфол, сюжетные локации, локации DLC - везде, где получилось добавить).
4. Бонус для тех, кто хочет услышать максимум: многоразовые точки. Пока не выполнены связанные с ними механизмы, точки работают при каждом входе. Первая пара - на корабле, в святилище (локация DLC "Тени пустоты"), часть паззла булавы Furia, и здесь можно слушать все бантеры взаимоотношений и реакций (кроме тех, что проигрываются в Коморре). Вторая пара - в Коморре, в шпиле Опустошительной Бури, сразу после входа на 2й этаж, и здесь можно слушать бантеры взаимоотношений и реакций на события Коморры. Смотрите скриншоты точных мест в разделе скриншотов.
Внимание: после выполнения паззла на булаву (или отключения ловушек в Шпиле) бантеры также перестанут проигрываться. Так что если вы хотите слушать бантеры, то просто бегайте между точками туда-сюда.
5. И новый бонус для тех, кто хочет услышать максимум: некоторые точки на карте ("лупы") при клике на них теперь тоже запускают бантеры. Смотрите скриншоты точных мест в разделе скриншотов, описание - в Update1.

Внимание! Использование модов блокирует получение достижений! Для разблокировки необходимо установить мод [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/1]Toy Box[/url] и сделать активным пункт "Allow Achievments While Using Mod" (первая страница, раздел ﻿Quality of Life).

Installation guide:
1. [url=https://github.com/microsoftenator2022/MicroPatches/releases]MicroPatches mod[/url] - MANDATORY! Create a directory MicroPatches in UnityModManager directory (<Users>\<username>\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 4000 Rogue Trader), and unpack archive MicroPatches-Mod with latest release there (MicroPatches-Editor is for modders only).

2. Unpack archive with my mod into Modifications directory (<Users>\<username>\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 4000 Rogue Trader).
3. Create "OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json" file in the <Users>\<username>\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader
4. Open it with notepad and paste { "EnabledModifications": ["BantersDiversity"] } 
OR
2. [url=https://github.com/CasDragon/ModFinder/releases/]Modfinder[/url] - get latest release, unpack it somewhere in your computer, run and put archive with my mod in the section "Drop zip here". 

Special thanks: Micro! Almost all my work wouldn't be possible without him. 
And another thanks: Owlcats, their game (and their bugs) are very inspiring :)

Name: Batteries in Pairs

Description:
Does having different macrocannon types on either side of your flagship bug you or is it just me?

[/code]

Name: Better Escort Ships
Author: jonHinkerton
About: Improve the escort ships so they can actually be helpful.

VersionHistory.Changelog: Changed pirate frigate spawn location so there would not be overlap if both were used.

Description:
Let's be honest, the escort ships from the Dargonus colony projects are a bit trash. This mod gives them some modest improvements to give them a role in the game, but not enough to trivialize or overshadow space battles.

The upgrades to both include adding a basic armor module and improving their shields by a step. The frigate receives a second pair of macrocannons and the destroyer swaps its torpedo launchers for the dual dorsal cannon of the pirate version of the ship.

And just for kicks I removed mutual exclusion - you can have both if you want.

Installation:

[b]Important[/b]: You will need to install [url=https://github.com/microsoftenator2022/MicroPatches]MicroPatches[/url] [b]version 1.17.4 or higher [/b]for this mod to work.

The easiest way to install it would be to use [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/146]Modfinder[/url]﻿.

If not using ModFinder, you will need to unzip the folder into your Game's Modifications folder. The path will be similar to C:\Users\Me\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\Modifications

Once the folder is there, you may need to edit your OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json file. This is one level up from the mod's folder. It needs to look something like:

[code]﻿{"$id":"1","SourceDirectories":[],"EnabledModifications":["jhBetterWingmen","BigFlagship","jhExpandedArchetypes"],"ActiveModifications":["jhBetterWingmen","jhExpandedArchetypes"],"DisabledModifications":[]}
[/code]
You will need to add the two entries for jhBetterWingmen following the format above. Once this file is edited you can start your game and you should see the mod in the in-game mod tool (not the built in Unity Mod Manager)

Name: Better Jae Talents

Description:
Updates Jae's base officer talents to make her much better at shooting things and make her heroic action not feel wasted compared to what
Cassia or a merc offers. Her new talents are as follows:

Abilities:
[list]
[*]Air of Authority
[*]Get Back in the Fight!
[/list]
Level Ups:[list]
[*]Ballistic Skill x2
[*]Fellowship x2
[*]Perception
[/list]
Skills:
[list]
[*]Lore Imperium
[*]Commerce
[*]Lore Xenos x2
[/list]
Class Talents:
[list]
[*]Leader's Assault
[*]Decisive Response
[*]Lead by Example
[*]Lasting Impression
[*]Wounds Are No Excuse!
[/list]
Common Talents:
[list]
[*]Ready to Serve
[*]Swift Movements
[*]Perception Training
[*]It Will Not Die
[/list]
Heroic Action:
[list]
[*]-1 AP Cost for non-attacks
[*]Increased damage and permanent Voice of Command
[/list]
The intended usage of this is to use Air of Authority + Get Back In The Fight! in order to set up Lead By Example and then Voice of Command to self-buff Jae's BS and Perception enough to reliably hit things without needing a second officer to buff her.

Note that this does not apply retroactively, you'll need to have this active when you recruit Jae for the first time in order for it to work.

Name: Better Type Sorting
Author: Arkive
About: This UMM mod patches inventory type sorting, so it sorts by subtypes, families, catgories, handedness, etc within weapons and armor categories

VersionHistory.Changelog: Added sorting to the ALL tab. Updated to work with Rogue Trader V1.2

Description:
This UMM mod patches inventory type sorting, so there's more detail to weapon and armor sorting than just alphabetical by display name.

[b]New sorting steps:[/b]
Armor sorting
[list=1]
[*]Racial Restriction
[*]Category (Light, Medium, Heavy)

[*]Armor Value
[*]Deflection
[*]Name
[/list]Weapon sorting
[list=1]
[*]Melee / Ranged
[*]Family (Damage type. e.g. Las,bolt)
[*]Category (e.g. Basic, Pistol)
[*]1 handed / 2 handed
[*]Heavy
[*]Name
[/list]Consumables
[list=1]
[*]Blueprint Name (I didn't find a usable (sub)type field, but most consumables are
prefixed with a subcategory. So most consumables are with their own
type, but not all.)
[/list]
[b]Installation:
[/b][list=1]
[*]        Download the mod file and unzip
[*]        If the folder is not already named BetterTypeSorting please rename it to that
[*]        Launch the game at least once.
[*]        Please note that the game comes with its own built in Unity Mod Manager so you do not need to install another one
[*]        Navigate to [i]%LocalAppData%Low\Owlcat Games[/i]\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\UnityModManager\
[*]        An example path is C:\Users\PC\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\UnityModManager\
[*]        Copy BetterTypeSorting into the UnityModManagerFolder
[*]        Launch Rogue Trader and you may need to hit ctrl+F10 to see the mod manager window
[*]        Load a save or start a new game
[*] ﻿Open your inventory, navigate to the weapons or armor tab, select one of the 'type' sorting options

[/list]
[b]Questions:[/b]
[list]
[*]Can I add/remove this mod to a saved game?
[list]
[*]Yes
[/list][*]Is this mod compatible with X mod?
[list]
[*]It may conflict with other mods if they change how the inventory is sorted.
[/list][*]Doesn't the base game already sort by type and categories?
[list]
[*]Version 1.2 added a lot more sorting criteria, but this mod still has more sorting criteria for armor.
[/list][/list]

Name: Bigger Flagship
Author: jonHinkerton
About: Increases the visual size of your flagship to make it more impressive.
Description:
Would a venerable dynasty like Von Velancius really rule from a mere frigate? I say no. This mod increases the visual model of your flagship, putting it closer to the size of a cruiser in-game.

Your ship still has its original footprint on the game map and no functionality is changed. I tried making it an actual cruiser, but things got real weird. As it is, diagonal alignments look a bit off.

In order for the change to take effect, you'll need to load into the game with the mod installed and then save the game from a star system map or a space battle then reload that save.

To install, extract the folder from the .zip file and place it in C:\Users\[you]\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\UnityModManager

Name: Cold Trader Origin
Author: jonHinkerton
About: Play your Rogue Trader or custom companions as the Cold Trader origin exclusive to Jae.

VersionHistory.Changelog: Fixed Coercion bonus
Fixed conviction reactivity
Added reactivity in the prologue
Compatability update. Requires micropatches 1.17.4+ delete existing version before installing.
Full rework into an origin following the style of other choices with new talents.

Added two-weapon fighting so gunsliger will work like Jae from the start.
Added dual-weapon fighting due to confusion with gunslinger
Initial Release

Description:
This mod expands upon Jae's Cold Trader origin, making it a fully fleshed-out origin suitable for PC use with a class ability, 5 talents, and associated stat and skill modifiers.

The class ability is Cold Trader's Acumen - grants a number of buffs based on your reputation with the trade factions.

The Talents include the remainder of the original talents plus three new ones that emphasize their focus on Skills, Fellowship, and Perception:

[list]
[*]Gunslinger reduces the cost of second weapon attacks while dual wielding.
[*]Never Play Fair allows you to use Fellowship for Int-based skills
[*]Cold Confidence lets the trader use Fellowship in place of Willpower
[*]Closer improves armor penetration on weakened opponents
[*]Watch Your Back uses Perception in place of Agility for dodge.
[/list]
Their triumphs and darkest hours have original text rather than copying the crime lord.

This mod also fixes the bug where Cold Trader's Acumen does not add the mentioned Coercion buff, you should not also use other mods that do the same as they will stack.

Note: This mod does not change Jae's abilities or options, only those of a Rogue Trader or mercenary companion.

Installation:

You will need to install [url=https://github.com/microsoftenator2022/MicroPatches]MicroPatches[/url] [b]version 1.17.4[/b] or higher for this mod to work.

The easiest way to install it would be to use [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/146]Modfinder[/url]﻿.

If not using ModFinder, you will need to unzip the folder into your Game's Modifications folder. The path will be similar to C:\Users\Me\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\Modifications

Once the folder is there, you may need to edit your OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json file. This is one level up from the mod's folder. It needs to look something like:

[code]﻿{"$id":"1","SourceDirectories":[],"EnabledModifications":["jhColdTrader","BigFlagship","jhExpandedArchetypes"],"ActiveModifications":["jhColdTrader","jhExpandedArchetypes"],"DisabledModifications":[]}
[/code]
You will need to add the two entries for jhColdTrader following the format above. Once this file is edited you can start your game and you should see the mod in the in-game mod tool (not the built in Unity Mod Manager)

Note: This mod fixes a bug in cold trader's acumen. If you also install [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/142]this mod[/url] it will double the fixed bonus, so don't, unless you want to.

Name: Commissar Unleashed
Author: Page
About: New talents for the Commissar origin and a rework of its main ability.

VersionHistory.Changelog:
Added Flamer Schola Talent: Hand Flamers attacks trigger their burning damage immediately on enemies already burning.
Added early game Old Reliable Bolt Pistol that can be used by the Commissar, given by Abelard in the warrant chamber on the Prologue.
Added early game unique Theodora's Plasma Pistol loot from Theodora safe on the Prologue. It can burst fire.
Added early game [Vulcan-Pattern] Hand Flamer to the Fellowship of the Void vendor in act 1. It can burst fire.
Fixed Return Fire targeting allies.
Fixed Plasma Schola single attacks increased area.
Language localization support
Release

Description:
[size=3]Overview:[/size]
In the base game, the Commissar is relegated to a support role. This mod aims to enhance the Commissar origin by providing more offensive options, allowing players to fulfill the fantasy of a sword-and-pistol fighter, a true carry like Ciaphas Cain himself.

[size=3]Main feature: 
[/size]
[list]
[*][size=2][b]Reworked At All Costs[/b]: Now after activation the Commissar's next attack is free of cost and doesn't count toward the attack limit.[/size]
[/list]
[size=3]New Talents:

[/size][list]
[*][size=2][b]﻿First to the Fray[/b]: The Commissar is the first to act in combat.[/size]
[/list][size=2]
[/size][list]
[*][size=2][b]No Quarter[/b]: Pistol attacks deal +(Ballistic Skill Bonus/ 2) damage to enemies that have less than 50% wounds.[/size]
[/list][size=2]
[/size][list]
[*][size=2][b]Return Fire[/b]: Parrying an attack while using a sword and pistol triggers a counter-attack with the pistol.[/size]
[/list][size=2]
[/size][list]
[*][size=2][b]Sword and Pistol Specialist[/b]: Receives no penalties or AP increase when using Dual-Weapon Combat(required) with a sword and pistol.[/size]
[/list][size=2]
[/size][list]
[*][size=2][b]Bolt Schola[/b]: Bolt pistols deal 20% bonus damage and have no recoil. Counts as having Bolter Weapon Proficiency.[/size]
[/list][size=2]
[/size][list]
[*][size=2][b]Plasma Schola[/b]: Plasma pistols area attacks are 1 tile wider and they have +10 bonus to hit. Counts as having Plasma Weapon Proficiency.[/size]
[/list][size=2]
[/size][list]
[*][size=2][b]Las Schola[/b]: Las pistols have double the rate of fire.[/size]
[/list][size=2]
[/size][list]
[*][size=2][b]Flamer Schola[/b]: Hand Flamers attacks trigger their burning damage immediately to enemies already suffering from burning. Counts as having Flame Weapon Proficiency.[/size]
[/list]
[size=3]New Weapons:[/size]

[list]
[*][size=2][b]Old Reliable[/b]: A bolt pistol that the Commissar can use without having proficiency. It is given to you by Abelard in the warrant chamber in the Prologue.[/size]
[/list][size=2]
[/size][list]
[*][size=2][b]Theodora's Plasma Pistol[/b]: A Plasma pistol capable of burst fire. Loot from Theodora safe in her chambers in the Prologue.[/size]
[/list][size=2]
[/size][list]
[*][size=2][b][Vulcan-Pattern] Hand Flamer[/b]: A Hand Flamer capable of burst fire. Sold by Fellowship of the Void Vendor in act 1.[/size]
[/list][size=2]
[/size][size=2]
[/size][size=3]Installation:
[/size]
[list]
[*][size=2]Easy:[/size]
[/list][list=1]
[*]﻿Download the file and drop it into[url=https://github.com/CasDragon/ModFinder/releases] Modfinder[/url]﻿.
[/list][list]
[*]Manual:
[/list][list=1]
[*][size=2]﻿Download the file.[/size]
[*][size=2]Extract into %LocalAppData%Low\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\Modifications\[/size]
[*][size=2]Open \AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\[i]OwlcatModificationManagerSettins.json[/i] in a editor.[/size]
[*][size=2]Add the mod name in the fields:[/size]
[/list][size=2] [/size]"EnabledModifications": ["CommissarUnleashed"],
"ActiveModifications": ["CommissarUnleashed"],

Name: Custom Escorts
Author: jonHinkerton
About: Change the visual appearance of your escort ships to any of a number of options.
Description:
Take control over your fledgling armada and make them whatever ship you want (as long as it's one of 9 ships). This mod lets you change the visual appearance of the escort ships granted as rewards for completing projects on Dargonus. It is only a cosmetic change, the ships retain their stats and mechanics.

The Frigate can be set to:
[list]
[*]Sword Frigate
[/list][list]
[*]Falchion Frigate
[*]Claymore Corvette
[*]Caos Frigate
[*]Aeldari Frigate
[*]Drukhari Frigate
[/list]
The Raider can be set to:
[list]
[*]Viper Destroyer
[/list][list]
[*]Cobra Destroyer
[*]Chaos Raider
[*]Aeldari Raider
[*]Drukhari Raider
[/list]
This mod works alongside my other mods that alter the escorts and the projects that grant them. You can improve the performance of the escorts with [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/189]Better Escort Ships[/url]﻿ and either that mod or [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/187]Build All Projects[/url]﻿ will let you build both escorts and have a little fleet of your own. Also check out [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/185]Custom Flagship[/url]﻿ to see what you can do about making your flagship look how you want it to.

To install, extract the jhCustomEscorts folder from the .zip file and place it in
C:\Users\[you]\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue
Trader\UnityModManager.

To use this mod, open the UMM menu (ctrl+F10), expand the options for Custom Escorts. Pick a ship for your escort(s), save the game and
reload.

Name: Custom Flagship
Author: jonHinkerton
About: If you've always wanted to cruise around the expanse in Calligos's big cruiser, here's your chance. This is a replacer for the appearance of the flagship in space battles. All the mechanics of the ship are untouched.,

VersionHistory.Changelog: Fixed original option
Added 3 more ships (Claymore, Cobra, Viper) and two new sizes (XLarge and XXLarge)
Added loadout view for ships that are capable. Added ability to revert to DLC ship. Fixed XXSmall size.

Description:
If you've always wanted to cruise around the expanse in Calligos's big cruiser, here's your chance. This is a replacer for the appearance of the flagship in space battles. All the mechanics of the ship are untouched.

I've included as many ships as I could that make sense.
[list]
[*]Imperial Sword class frigate
[*]Imperial Dictator class cruiser
[*]Imperial Gothic class cruiser
[*]Imperial Mass Conveyor transport
[*]Imperial Claymore Corvette
[*]Imperial Viper Destroyer
[*]Imperial Cobra Destroyer

[/list]And for you degenerates out there insisting on being heretics
[list]
[*]Chaos frigate
[*]Chaos Cruiser
[/list]

To use this, open the UMM menu (ctrl+F10), expand the options for Custom Flagship. Pick a ship and a size using the buttons. Save the game and reload.


Caveats: This isn't perfect. First of all, the image of the larger ships on the loadout screen had to be disabled to prevent a crash, but the screen still works normally. It doesn't update any of the ship silhouettes. It won't let you pick a DLC frigate, but if you are using one you can go back to it by selecting the Original option.


To install, extract the folder from the .zip file and place it in C:\Users\[you]\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue
Trader\UnityModManager. To access the options, enter ctrl+F10 to bring up the UMM menu.

Description:
# EnhancedControls - mod for Warhammer 40000: Rogue Trader

Adds UX related stuff. 

If you're a user, downloads are on the right. See **Releases** link.
You can see detailed mod description on [Nexus page](https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/14).


## How to build

1. Get the usual tools (Visual Studio and .NET development stuff)
2. Clone the repo
3. Build. And then Build again. Project looks up your RT installation dir from your game logs (so you need to run the game at least once).

That's it. On Build output is copied into UMM folder in appdata.


## How to contribute localization

After installing the mod localization files are in `Localization` folder.   
If you named mod install folder `EnhancedControls` then full path to them would be `%userprofile%\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\UnityModManager\EnhancedControls\Localization`

English localization is in `enGB.json`

Copy this file and rename new file according to the language you're translating into.
Russian  - `ruRU.json`    
German   - `deDE.json`   
French   - `frFR.json`   
Chinese  - `zhCN.json`    
Spanish  - `esES.json`   
Japanese - `jaJP.json`   

(If your system is set to hide file extensions and you don't see `.json`, then ignore that part)

Open your new localization file with any text editor - but for best results use something with syntax highlight - Notepad++, Visual Studio Code, or something else.   
Change **Text** properties to translate things.  
Start the game in chosen language to see the effect. Or switch the language in settings, the mod will reload your changes.

Send me translation file if you want me to include your translation with the mod.

Description:
[b]Installation[/b]
[list=1]
[*]Download the mod archive.

Name: Expanded Archetypes
Author: jonHinkerton
About: Expanded Archetypes is a project to add new abilities and talents to the existing character class archetypes in Rogue Trader. The goal is to provide novelty, added variety, and more interesting build decisions.

VersionHistory.Changelog: Fixed the missing first tier exemplar talents.
Since shotguns are now 1 ap in the base game, the talent that granted that perk to soldiers has been replaced with a trait to increases overpenetration.
Added Chinese localization
Overhead smash fixed.
Streetsweeper fix
Fixed priority target buff on disengage and vanish
Fixes, new talents, unlocked level 3 ability choice, added spanish and french localizations
Added a dodgy chatGPT Spanish localization
First release version. Soldier added. Shotgun tree moved to soldier and flame tree added for warrior.
Officer added

Description:
Expanded Archetypes is a project to add new abilities and talents to the existing character class archetypes in Rogue Trader. The goal is to provide novelty, added variety, and more interesting build decisions.

The goal is to add abilities and talents to each of the original four tier 1 archetypes. I am trying to loosely theme these around the idea of trees, related features that build out a clear but missing niche for those paths. I am focused on tier 1 as I feel that is where broader choices belong while tier 2 is intended for specialization.

The Soldier gets a shotgun tree and heavy weapons talents.
[list]
[*]The Pistol Whip ability lets a ranged weapon-equipped soldier mix in some melee up close with the ability to stun the target.
[*]The Butt Strike talent gives additional damage to Pistol Whip when using a two-handed ranged weapon.
[*]The Street Sweeper talent makes pushbacks on shotgun blasts occur even on a miss.
[*]Shearing Shots adds an additional 50% overpenetration.
[*]The Gut Shot talent makes shotgun attacks on adjacent targets automatically hit.
[*]Big Guns adds 10 armor when wielding a heavy weapon.
[*]Suppressing Fire slows targets hit by heavy weapons.
[/list]
The Operative gets a sneaky tree and a broader foundation to build on:
[list]
[*]The Disengage ability lets the operative safely extract themselves from melee and lower their target priority
[*]The Backstab talent increases damage while the Operative is the lowest priority target
[*]The Marked Target talent leaves one exploit intact when abilities would otherwise remove them all
[*]The Vanish talent expands the Perfect Spot ability by making the operative the lowest priority target when Perfect Spot is used
[*]No Scope reduces the cost of deadeye shots.
[*]Additional attributes and skills added to level-up to allow for more diverse characters.
[/list]
The Officer gets a heroic self-buff tree.
[list]
[*]Deeds Not Words is an ability that gives a full stat buff based on Fellowship.
[*]The Shield of Courage talent is a Deeds upgrade that adds armor to the buff
[*]The Guide My Hand talent is another Deeds buff that makes attacks automatically hit.
[*]The Audacity talent lets the officer substitute Fellowship for Agility in calculating Dodge.
[/list]
The Warrior gets a flamer tree and two-handed weapon talents.
[list]
[*]Fuel for the Fire is an ability that triggers instances of burning on nearby targets.
[*]Pyromaniac is a talent that refunds 1 ap the first time a flame or melta weapon is used in a turn.
[*]Conflagration is a talent that adds stracks of burning based on ballistic skill.
[*]Enveloping Flames is a talent that increases the minimum damage of flame and melta weapons based on ballistic skill.
[*]Cleave Through does damage to an adjacent opponent following a kill while wielding a two-handed melee weapon.
[*]Overhead Smash increases armor penetration while wielding a two-handed melee weapon.
[/list]

You may need to respec to see changes.

This is still a work in progress.Feel free to use the comments to suggest more additions to archetypes in the future.


Installation:

You will need to install [url=https://github.com/microsoftenator2022/MicroPatches]MicroPatches[/url] [b]version 1.17.4+[/b] for this mod to work.

The easiest way to install it would be to use [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/146]Modfinder[/url]﻿.

If not using ModFinder, you will need to unzip the folder into your Game's Modifications folder. The path will be similar to C:\Users\Me\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\Modifications

Once the folder is there, you may need to edit your OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json file. This is one level up from the mod's folder. It needs to look something like:

[code]﻿{"$id":"1","SourceDirectories":[],"EnabledModifications":["ColdTraderOccupation","BigFlagship","jhExpandedArchetypes"],"ActiveModifications":["ColdTraderOccupation","jhExpandedArchetypes"],"DisabledModifications":[]}
[/code]
You will need to add the two entries for jhExpandedArchetypes following the format above. Once this file is edited you can start your game and you should see the mod in the in-game mod tool (not the built in Unity Mod Manager)

Name: Expanded Colony Projects
Author: jonHinkerton
About: More projects to keep your colonies busy with.

VersionHistory.Changelog: faction project tweaks
Added Russian translation
Added Extraction projects
Added conviction projects
Fixed refractor field(?), tweaked some reward items, added Chinese translation to main file.

Bug fixes
Added spanish and french localizations. No mod changes.
Added 10 new projects with story-based text and original item rewards.

Description:
Did you feel like you ran out of colony projects a little too soon? I did. So I made more.

Expanded Colony Projects adds 56 somewhat interdependent common new projects to all of your colonies
[list]
[*]Arbitrage projects let you trade goods around your colonies, swapping resources to keep other projects going.
[*]Development projects give you something to do with your surplus goods, by turning them into improvements to your colony stats.
[*]Faction projects let you juice your reputations a little here and there.
[*]Story projects expand on the colony narrative and include original item rewards.
[*]Conviction projects available only to Rogue Traders with rank 3+ in a conviction.
[*]Extraction projects allow you to gain resources at the expense of colony development.
[/list]
There are a set of these projects available at level 2 and another at level 4. The resources traded in each colony and at each level are different so you can trade strategically.

This mod does work alongside my [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/187]Build All Projects[/url] mod.

Installation:

You will need to install [url=https://github.com/microsoftenator2022/MicroPatches]MicroPatches[/url] v1.17.6+ for this mod to work.

The easiest way to install it would be to use [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/146]Modfinder[/url]﻿.

If not using ModFinder, you will need to unzip the folder into your Game's Modifications folder. The path will be similar to C:\Users\Me\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\Modifications

Once the folder is there, you may need to edit your OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json file. This is one level up from the mod's folder. It needs to look something like:

[code]﻿{"$id":"1","SourceDirectories":[],"EnabledModifications":["ColdTraderOccupation","jhColonyProjects","jhExpandedArchetypes"],"ActiveModifications":["ColdTraderOccupation","jhColonyProjects","jhExpandedArchetypes"],"DisabledModifications":[]}
[/code]

You will need to add the two entries for jhColonyProjects following the format above. Once this file is edited you can start your game and you should see the mod in the in-game mod tool (not the built in Unity Mod Manager)

Name: Faster Loading Times
Author: Seamato
About: Reduces loading times in Rogue Trader by up to 50%, depending on your specific hardware. Especially noticeable for saves in later acts. Let me know how much of an improvement you see!

VersionHistory.Changelog: Initial release.

Name: Fix Cold Trader's Acumen
Author: Mawootad
About: Fixes Jae's Cold Trader's Acumen origin talent to give the listed bonuses to skills.
Description: Jae's Cold Trader's Acumen origin talent is supposed to give bonuses to skills based on 2x your faction rep with them, however it actually gives no bonus for Fellowship of the Void and only a 1x bonus for Kasballica and Explorators. This fixes Fellowship of the Void to give 2x faction rank to Coercion and Kasballica and Explorators to give 2x to Commerce and Tech Use respectively.

Name: Flame Weapon Expert Fix
Author: Seroster
About: A small fix for Flame Weapon Expert not affecting 3 of the unique flamers.

VersionHistory.Changelog: First Published Version

Description:
I happened to notice that, as of the current date/patch (1.2.19), 3 unique flamers have an attack that is not affected by the Flame Weapon Expert talent: Fiery Retribution (unique #3 attack), Purging Fury (#2 attack), & the Toxic Flamer (also the #2 attack.) This resulted in a situation where those attacks cost 2 AP regardless of whether you had the talent or not. I assume this is a bug (despite the latter 2 appearing to have a normal 2nd attack, in actuality all 3 affected attacks have a unique ID, which were not on the current list of attacks the talent affects), but I can't say that definitively.

Easiest way to install IMO is drag & drop the Zip into the bottom panel of the Rogue Trader version of Modfinder.

I'm hoping that Owlcat will fixt this issue themselves so none of us have to worry about this, but it is VERY unlikely I will devote any time to keeping this up to date unless I happen to be actively playing RT at that point in the future.

A rather niche fix in the grand scheme of things that I made mostly for myself, but I thought someone out there might find useful. It happens to be my first & probably? only mod I'll ever publish. Hopefully someone else will get a use out of it!

Update 12/24/24:
1.) I realized the version # I listed on the Nexus (1.4) was apparently mismatched w/ the "real"/functional version # (1.0.4). I attempted to update the Nexus listing to correct the error. Given that I'm rather inexperienced w/ all of this, I'm not fully sure when/if this will be reflected in Modfinder and/or if this will result in some weird "ghost versions" lingering about in the Nexus systems. Anyway, there were no actual changes to the mod itself, just an update to the proper version # in the Nexus listing.

2. According to their patch notes, Owlcat fixed the Toxic Flamer's #2 attack in patch 1.3.0.47 , but I couldn't find any mention of changes for the other 2 flamers this mod affects. As such, this appears to be redundant if you only wanted the fix for the Toxic Flamer, but is probably? still needed for the other 2. I say probably bc I've not really tested the mod in any way post-patch other than booting the game up & checking the character screen (I'm waiting for the DLC to push through another full playthrough). Anyway, the character screen says the AP reduction is still functioning & I didn't see any observable issues w/ the affected flamers from there, so AFAIK it still appears to be functioning more or less as it was pre-patch.

Name: Free Respec
Author: ADDB
About: Allows changing the Respec Cost Behaviour.

VersionHistory.Changelog: Initial Release

Description:
Allows changing the Respec Cost Behaviour.

[b]Installation[/b]
[list=1]
[*]Download the mod archive.
[*]If not done yet, launch the game at least once.
[*]Navigate to [code]%userprofile%\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\UnityModManager\[/code]
For example, the path might look like this: [i]C:\Users\PC\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\UnityModManager\[/i]

[*]Create a new folder in the UnityModManager directory and unarchive the mod archive there.
[*]Launch Rogue Trader and after reaching the Main Menu you can hit ctrl+F10 to see the mod manager window.
[/list]

[b]Usage[/b]
To use:
[list=1]
[*]Click the button in the FreeRespec mod section of the UnityModManager GUI (opened by pressing CTRL + F10).

[*]Pick one of the [b]four different modes[/b]:
[list]
[*][b]Free[/b]: Respecs are always free.
[*][b]Always pay x[/b]: Respecs will cost a certain amount you can choose.
[*][b]Pay at most x[/b]: Respecs will cost the normal amount but stop getting more expensive after reaching a certain amount you can choose.
[*][b]Normal Game Behaviour[/b]: Literally normal game behaviour.
[/list]
[/list]
Since using Mods normally disables Achievements, I suggest also using the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/4]Allow Modded Achievements[/url] mod or [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/1]Toy Box[/url] to re-enable them.

Name: Homeworlds of the Expanse
Author: OdinThePine
About: This mod expands the selection of Homeworlds available during character creation by introducing 7 new custom options inspired by the game's original manuals. Each world is lore-friendly and emphasizes a specific playstyle or theme.

VersionHistory.Changelog:
The Servitors donated by Pleasure World [Revel in Riches] have been handed over to the Admech for repurposing and will not follow the character anymore.
Feral World: [Fleshcarver] fixed and changed the bleeding effect from flat 2 to armorpen/5

Fixed Tainted World [Warp-Touched] giving negative values
Feral World [Rage&Woe] works now for Primitive and Blade weapons
Fixed Tainted World [Forbidden Lore]  from 2 to 5xHeretical...again
Typos

Added a 7th Homeworld: Pleasure World
Fixed localization an tooltips for each world. External localizations will break, but i tried to machine-translate every text i could
Tainted World [Forbidden Lore] multiplicator changed from 2 to 5 x Heretical Rank
Fixed the Convinction Rank bugs for Tainted e Shrine worlds - Withering Shard and other "temporary convinction" should now work properly
Agri World [To Work The Land] bonus resolve changed from + 1 to +3
Agri World [Supply Line] now heals Wounds(hp), not Injuries
Compatibility fix for other Origins and Homeworlds mod
Fixed a bug that prevented the loading of lists on fresh installations
Fixed the visual duplication bug for PlayableX users. Added Tainted World to the companion list. Expanded the Chinese localization by user "rgehxr".
new Homeworld: "Tainted World". Added Chinese localization by user "nsfwmod". Fixed typos.
Fixed a bug blocking the Archetype advancement for Shrine World characters
Fixed a compatibility bug with PlayableX
Initial Release

Description:
[b]
[b][b][color=#00ff00]How to Install (Easy)[/color]

[/b][/b][/b][list=1]
[*]Download [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/146]ModFinder[/url]﻿ 
[*]Drag&Drop HomeworldsOfTheExpanse.zip in Modfinder
[/list][b][b]
How to Install (Hard)[/b]
[/b]
[list=1]
[*]Download the file
[*]Find the Modification folder in \AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\Modifications\
[*]Extract or paste the file into the Modification folder
[*]Add the folder name to the \AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\[i]OwlcatModificationManagerSettins.json[/i] file; it should look like this:[code]  "EnabledModifications": ["HomeworldsOfTheExpanse"], "ActiveModifications": ["HomeworldsOfTheExpanse"],[/code]

[*]Start a new game or create a new Companion in an existing save

[/list]
NOTES: this is a OwlcatModManager mod and requires [url=https://github.com/microsoftenator2022/MicroPatches]MicroPatches[/url] to load properly.



With this mod I tried to expand the list of selectable Homeworlds with lore-friendly and balanced (?) options. I researched the original [i]Rogue Trader[/i] manuals, transposing, if not the Talents and stats, at least the mood and themes from the original pen-and-paper RPG.

Like the 6 vanilla options, each of the 7 new Homeworlds has an Innate Feat and a selection of 5 Talents built around the main theme, whether for gameplay or roleplay. New Homeworlds may be added in the future.
[b]
[/b]
[b]FRONTIER WORLD[/b] -  exotic weapons, interactions with xenos, guns
[list]
[*]Initial feature: Aeldari and Drukari weapon [b]Proficiency[/b]
[*][b]Exotic Arsenal[/b] - +10% crichance for exotic and xeno weapons
[*][b]Showdown[/b] - +10% dodge when out of cover using a ranged weapon
[*][b]Xenotech Enjoyer[/b] - bonus to lore (Xeno) and damage on xeno, based on Kasballica Reputation
[*][b]Lawless [/b]- immunities to prone and opportuynity attack negation
[*][b]Friendly Neighbor[/b] - +5 FEL to allied xenos
[/list]
[b]FERAL WORLD[/b] - strength, primitive weapons, berserker-like playstyle[list]
[*]Initial feature: [b]Rage and Woe[/b] - armor pen with primitive and blade weapons, but take more damages from warp source
[*][b]Untamed Vitality[/b] - +(2xSTR) Bonus wounds
[*][b]Terrifying Presence[/b] - lower neares enemies WS by STR Bonus
[*][b]Savage Bargains[/b] - Persuasion, Cohercion and Carouse based on Strength
[*][b]Fleshcarver[/b] - melee weapons inflicts armorpen/5 bleeding
[*][b]Tribesman[/b] - unlock an ability (+15 STR +15 WS -20WP)
[/list][b]
PENAL WORLD[/b] - be mean, do crime[list]
[*]Initial feature: [b]Know no Better[/b] - Weapon Skills for Coercion; +Resolve% critical damage on stunned or prone enemie
[/list][list]
[*][b]Start the Riot[/b] - stun on enemies at full health with a melee attack and a WS save
[*][b]Troublemaker[/b] - +2 initiative
[*][b]Any Means Necessary[/b] - can reroll Carouse, Coercion and Awareness test
[*][b]You Are a Pirate![/b] - Reputation with Fellowshid to CritChance and Coercion
[*][b]Pick a Fight[/b] - unclock Taunting Scream Ability
[/list]
[b]SHRINE WORLD[/b] - stacks of burning, grenades, extra damage against the heretics

[b]AGRI WORLD[/b] - toughness, incremental bonus

[b]TAINTED WORLD[/b] - perils of the warp, scaling on heretical ranks

[b]PLEASURE WORLD[/b]- Fellowship bonus, scaling on Profit Factor, skill-monkey


[b][color=#00ff00][b]FAQ, ISSUES and ﻿[/b][b]FIXES:[/b][/color][/b]
[b]- ﻿Is compatible with Lex Imperialis? |[/b] Yes, but keep reading[b];
﻿- A lot of Talents have no text! |[/b] After the relase of Lex Imperialis, a fresh installation of the Mod is [u]required[/u]. Just delete the Homeworlds of the Expanse folder from \AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\Modifications\ before installing a new version from 1.2+. You can do this on an existing save without consequences.
﻿[b]- Is [b][mod X][/b] compatible with HomeworldsOfTheExpanse?[/b] | Yes. We are going to patch only the files for Character Generation. Except the Navigator Origin from [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/139]PlayableX[/url]﻿, every Chargen mod using MicroPatches will work, and every non-CharGen mod will not interact with our changes.
[b] ﻿- Can you create a [SomethingWorld]?[/b] | Right now I'm working on [u]Feudal/Knight[/u] and Civilized [u](Iconoclast[/u]) Homeworlds, and I'm brainstorming 3-4 other ideas. Suggestions are welcome, whether about themes, Talents, or builds.





Feel free to use the comments section to suggest additions and changes. I am not an expert in builds by any means, and your opinion could be valuable help.

[i]
[/i][i]Thanks to the community on the official Discord server for the help and guidance with this project.[/i]

Name: Human Weapons for Eldar
Author: jonHinkerton
About: Human Weapon Proficiency talent for eldar companions.
Description:
The Eldar may be proud, but they're not foolish. When there's a perfectly good rifle laying around the Rogue Trader's ship the only thing stopping them from using it is a bit of cultural bias. This mod gets them over that. For the price of a talent choice, they can gain access to your regular human weapons in the same way that your Rogue Trader can gain access to theirs.

The other requirements must still be met, though - i.e. a plasma gun still requires plasma weapons proficiency.

It should become available upon installing but if not, try a respec.

[b]Installation:[/b]

You will need to install [url=https://github.com/microsoftenator2022/MicroPatches]MicroPatches[/url] [b]version 1.17.4+[/b] for this mod to work.

The easiest way to install it would be to use [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/146]Modfinder[/url]﻿.

If not using ModFinder, you will need to unzip the folder into your Game's Modifications folder. The path will be similar to C:\Users\Me\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\Modifications

Once the folder is there, you may need to edit your OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json file. This is one level up from the mod's folder. It needs to look something like:

[code]﻿{"$id":"1","SourceDirectories":[],"EnabledModifications":["jhHumanWeaponProf"],"ActiveModifications":["jhHumanWeaponProf"],"DisabledModifications":[]}
[/code]
You will need to add the two entries for jhHumanWeaponProf following the format above. Once this file is edited you can start your game and you should see the mod in the in-game mod tool (not the built in Unity Mod Manager)

Name: Little Birds
Author: jonHinkerton
About: Smaller, less distracting bird familiars
Description:
The birds are just there, flapping and getting in the way of things you need to look at or click on. They don't need to be bigger than people. So now they're not. Should have no impact on the game itself.

To install, extract the jhLittleBirds folder from the .zip file and place it in C:\Users\[you]\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue
 Trader\UnityModManager.

Name: Medicae Archetype
Author: jonHinkerton
About: A new tier 1 archetype with a focus on healing and party buffs.

VersionHistory.Changelog: Apothecarion Servoskull and Combat Drugs now properly retransmit through overseer skulls. Fixed combat drugs percentage.

Enabled overseer with servoskulls as a tier 2 choice. Note: the downside of the desperate version of triage is disabled right now, I have to sort it out. It just does the same thing as the heroic for now.
Fixed issues with Well Stocked and To The Rescue.
Level up fix
Fixed for 1.4/Lex Imperialis
Fixed prerequites on some talents related to To the rescue.
Fixed prologue chest bug
Fixed warrant chamber starting gear.
Localization fixes

Description:
Note: Can now take overseer with servoskulls in tier 2. The desperate version of triage has issues right now so it just does what the heroic does for now.

Lives are spent freely on the battlefields of the Imperium, but they are not wasted. A soldier who can take back up their lasgun is more valuable than one bleeding out in the mud. Tending to survivable injuries and relieving those whose wounds are not is the task of the Medicae. These driven battlefield chiurgeons carry an array of wound treatments and combat drugs which have returning soldiers to the line as their only purpose - long term outcomes are beyond their charge.

The medicae is a new tier 1 archetype for rogue traders and companions. It includes entirely new active abilities and talents and introduces a new team role to the party as well as the ability to bring back fallen teammates during combat and an attempt at bringing a pet mechanic into the game (pre-Lex).

The medicae has the following active abilities:

[list]
[*][b]Battlefield Medicine[/b] - The medicae heals an adjacent ally for (Medicae/4)+(Medicae/10) wounds. This ability also removes bleeding, burning, and toxin, and clears one fresh injury.
[*][b]Resuscitate[/b] - An adjacent downed ally is brought back to action with 10% of their maximum wounds.
[*][b]Apothecarion Servoskull[/b] - This servoskull may heal any ally within 6 cells for (Medicae/4)+(Tech Use/10) wounds.
[*][b]To the Rescue[/b] - The medicae can move up to 3 + resolve cells. Ends movement for the turn.
[*][b]Medevac[/b] - An ally up to 6 cells away moves to the closest adjacent cell.
[*][b]Combat Drugs[/b] - This ability adds 20% of the medicae's medicae skill to the target's Strength, Toughness, and Agility for 2 turns.
[*][b]The Emporer's Peace[/b] - The medicae can deal fatal damage to an adjacent incapacitated enemy (One who is stunned or can't act).
[/list]
The medicae's momentum ability is Triage:[list]
[*][b]Triage[/b] - This ability heals all allies 50% of their maximum wounds.
[*][b]Triage[/b] (Desperate) - This ability heals all allies 50% of their maximum wounds but deals 50% of the medicae's wounds to themself.
[*][b]Triage (Upgrade 1)[/b] - All allies are instead healed to full wounds.
[*][b]Triage (Upgrade 2)[/b] - Allies targeted by Triage are immune to fatal wounds for one turn.
[*][b]Triage (Upgrade 3)[/b] - Triage also removes burning, bleeding, and toxin from allies.
[*][b]Triage (Upgrade 4)[/b] - Triage adds a 10% boost to the medicae's medicae skill for the rest of the combat.
[/list]
The medicae's talents:[list]
[*][b]Well-Stocked[/b] - The medicae has 50% chance to not use a charge when using a medikit.
[*][b]Diagnosticar[/b] - Battlefield Medicine heals an additional 5% per dot on the target.
[*][b]Anatomist[/b] - The medicae gains a medicae skill/5 bonus to critical hit chance with chain weapons and needle weapons.
[*][b]Amputate[/b] - Melee hits with chain weapons cause carouse/15 levels of bleeding to the target.
[*][b]Bonesaw[/b] - The damage bonus with chain weapons is based on carouse skill instead of strength.
[*][b]Precocious Servoskull[/b] - The Apothecarion Servoskull can be used on allies up to 10 cells away.
[*][b]Stay Low[/b] - Using To the Rescue makes the medicae the lowest priority target for one turn.
[*][b]Reanimator[/b] - The target of Resuscitate gains an additional 10% of the medicae's medicae skill wounds.
[*][b]Overmedicate[/b] - The target of Battlefield Medicine gains the medicae's medicae skill/10 temporary wounds in addition to normal healing.
[*][b]Innoculate[/b] - The target of Combat Drugs gains +10 to all resistances for 2 rounds.
[*][b]Chiurgeon[/b] - Battlefield Medicine has a chance to clear one trauma on the target.
[*][b]Bad Medicine[/b] - Successful attacks with needle weapons add additional toxin stacks equal to 10% of the medicae's medicae skill.
[*][b]Synskin Grafter[/b]- When the medicae uses Battlefield Medicine on an ally, that ally gains 5% armor for the remainder of combat..
[*][b]First Responder[/b] - The medicae adds their perception bonus to initiative rolls.
[*][b]Help is on the Way[/b] - Using To the Rescue does not provoke attacks of opportunity from adjacent opponents.
[*][b]Now or Never[/b] - The medicae's medicae skill is increased by 10% when momentum is below 50.
[*][b]Combat Veteran[/b] - Increase the medicae's resolve by the number of medicae abilities known.
[/list]
The medicae can select assassin, executioner, master tactician, or overseer in tier 2.


[b]Installation:[/b]

You will need to install [url=https://github.com/microsoftenator2022/MicroPatches]MicroPatches[/url] [b]version 1.17.6+[/b] for this mod to work.

The easiest way to install it would be to use [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/146]Modfinder[/url]﻿. Download the .zip file and drag it into the Modfinder window or select it from the list.

If not using ModFinder, you will need to unzip the folder into your Game's Modifications folder. The path will be similar to C:\Users\Me\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\Modifications

Once the folder is there, you may need to edit your OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json file. This is one level up from the mod's folder. It needs to look something like:

[code]﻿{"$id":"1","SourceDirectories":[],"EnabledModifications":["jhMedicae"],"ActiveModifications":["jhMedicae"],"DisabledModifications":[]}
[/code]
You will need to add the two entries for jhMedicae following the format above. Once this file is edited you can start your game and you should see the mod in the in-game mod tool (not the built in Unity Mod Manager)

Name: MicroPatches
Author: Microsoftenator
About: Tiny patches attempting to fix minor bugs and silence annoying log messages. Experimental patches require more testing and can be toggled in the mod settings (requires restart to take effect). If you encounter any issues with an experimental patch, let me know in the issues on this repository.

VersionHistory.Changelog: For some reason the zip for the previous release did not contain all the changes

Update for game version 1.4.0

New: mod template extension installer. Applies some assembly patches in addition to extracting the scripts previously in the "Editor" zip

- Edit Mode blueprint patches shoudl work again
- Auto-generate localization file entries for included blueprints
- More fixes for nested array elements in Micro json patches

Mod build now builds a localization file for bluepirnts

JsonPatch can now use index as array element identifier

New template fixes and features:
- Partial fix for the  the "Repair SharedString configs" menu item
- Can now start game services to load assets from bundles into the editor. These cannot be edited but this should allow creating inherited blueprints without losing asset references
- Fixed a null reference exception in the blueprint editor
- Fixed reference graph ("references.xml not found" error)
- Several bug fixes and minor improvements for Micro blueprint patches
JsonPatch: Handle duplicate and relocated array elements

- Test release for my new Blueprint Patch replacements/enhancements. This should better handle nested changes (eg. no need to delete and add back array elements) and should allow for better interactions between mods that edit the same blueprints.
- Fixes a bug when combining "Better Mod Logger" with Owlmods depending on MicroPatches
- Owlmods can now depend on any UMM mod

Known issue: if a patch has no changes, a patch file will be created containing only the string "unspecified".

- **New**: My Blueprint Patch replacement/enhancements. This should better handle nested changes (eg. no need to delete and add back array elements) and should allow for better interactions between mods that edit the same blueprints.
- Fixes a bug when combining "Better Mod Logger" with Owlmods depending on MicroPatches
- **New**: Owlmods can now depend on any UMM mod

Description:
# MicroPatches (Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader)

Transmechanic Microsoftenator once again fixing bugs and cleaning logs.

Tiny patches attempting to fix bugs in the game's mod support, extend tools for modders, fix other minor bugs, and silence annoying log messages.
Experimental patches require more testing and can be toggled in the mod settings (requires restart to take effect).
If you encounter any issues with an experimental patch, let me know in the issues on this repository.

**WARNING: ALL EXPERIMENTAL PATCHES ARE DISABLED BY DEFAULT FOR A REASON. THEY MAY BREAK YOUR GAME AND/OR SAVES. ACTIVATE AT YOUR OWN RISK.**

## Mod Developers: Editor Template Extension Installation

Name: Operative Rework
Author: Mawootad
About: Reworks the Operative to bring their power level closer to other T1 archetypes and give them a clearer gameplan.

VersionHistory.Changelog: Fixes expose weakness and exploit calculations for real
Actually fixes expose weakness not reducing stats
Fixes expose weakness increasing armor, parry, and dodge by 1% per stack instead of decreasing armor, parry, and dodge by 5% per stack
Added Russian localization courtesy of @Sqwero
Fixed bad string keys in two expose weakness blueprints that may have been causing flaky patching failures

Exploits and expose weakness are now tracked separately for each Operative in the party. Operatives only gain bonus exploit damage vs exploits they have applied and can't remove exploits from other Operatives.
Expose Weakness is also tracked separately, and multiple casts from different Operatives stack but only count their own stacks of Expose Weakness for the first hit buff.
Passive Learning 2 INT -> 1 INT
Expose Weakness's talent now correctly has a description
Vid-Capture Relay should work now
Source for the mod is now tracked on GitHub at https://github.com/Mawootad/OperativeRework

Expose Weakness thresholds 3/6/10 -> 3/7/12
Passive Learning 1 + exploits/5 INT -> 2 INT
Passive Learning correctly triggers on units with Passive Learning rather than on units with Continuous Analysis
Tactical Knowledge no longer gives its armor bonus twice
Intimidation also reduces MP by 3.

Expose Weakness 10 stack effect correctly only grants an extra attack instead of granting an extra use of any ability
Swapped Continuous Analysis and Passive Learning

Tactical Knowledge PER damage scaling -> INT
Insightful Precision now works
Improved Tactics new effect, +1 stack of Tactical Knowledge on combat start and when using Tactical Knowledge
Fixed a bug where Tactical Knowledge and Informed Hit had stat calculations that differed from the tooltips

Description:
The Operative is currently significantly weaker than other T1 archetypes, this mod significantly buffs Operative's abilities and makes the behavior flow together better. The new Operative leans heavily into debuffing support paired with very high single target damage. Their exploits are no longer consumed on hit and provide a team-wide damage boost but their overall damage boost for the Operative is generally lower, but their real damage output now comes from Expose Weakness. Expose Weakness keeps the team-wide damage boosts from exploits for the turn it's active in addition to stripping armor, dodge, parry, and block while massively boosting the damage of the Operative's next attack plus granting additional boosts according to the number of stacks removed. Along with general improvements to weaker abilities and talents this should help reinforce the Operative's strengths as a single-target damage specialist and debuffer while still retaining their defined weaknesses of limited mobility and multi-target damage.

Note that this is currently in a beta state; there may be bugs or weird balancing.

Installation Instructions:
[list]
[*]Download ModFinder ([url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/146]https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/146[/url]﻿)
[*]Open ModFinder
[*]Drag the mod zip file into ModFinder
[*]Mod is now installed. You may need to close and reopen Rogue Trader to see any changes.
[/list]
Overall changelist is as follows:
[list]
[*]Exploit: No longer removed on hit. Stacks increase all damage taken by 5%, including for damage over time and from allies. The operative deals +5 + PER% per stack instead. Exploits from multiple Operatives stack, however Operatives only gain bonus damage for their own stacks and cannot remove stacks from other Operatives.
[*]Expose Weakness: Now increases damage by 5% per stack, debuff scaling changed to a flat -5% armor, parry, block, and dodge. Casts of Expose Weakness now stack between uses by the same Operative, although duration is not increased by subsequent casts. After using Expose Weakness, the Operative's next attack vs the target deals an additional +(10 + stacks) x PER% damage and provides further boosts based on the number of weaknesses on the target:
[list]
[*]3+ stacks: The attack auto-hits
[*]6+ stacks: The attack auto-crits and ignores deflection
[*]10+ stacks: The operative regains 2 AP and can make an extra attack this turn
[/list][/list][list]
[*]Joint Analysis: No longer removes exploits, instead adds an exploit when allies hit an enemy, but limited to one proc per enemy per turn.
[*]Precise Attack: No longer requires exploits to work. Scaling 15 + 3 * exploits% -> 10 + 2 * PER%. Now also reduces dodge. Now additionally applies 2 exploits.
[*]Informed Hit: Critical hits with Precise Attack apply an additional stack of exploit. Auto-crit threshold 10 - INT -> 6 - INT/2.
[*]Insightful Precision: Scaling changed to flat +5 perception when using Precise Attack
[*]Intimidation: Scaling 5 + PER/2% -> 15 + PER%, but no longer doubles vs low armor. Also reduces MP by 3.
[*]Terrifying Presence: Killing a target with Intimidation now also extends the range to LoS.
[*]Perfect Spot: Applies exploits to all enemies in LoS at the start of the Operative's turn.
[*]Tactical Knowledge: No longer removes all stacks when cast vs a single target. Armor scaling 1% -> 1 + INT/5%. Damage scaling 2% -> 2 + INT/2%. Stacks between multiple casts.
[*]Improved Tactics: New effect, adds a stack of Tactical Knowledge at the start of combat and grants +1 additional stacks when using Tactical Knowledge.
[*]Dismantling Attack: Applies 6 stacks of Exploit Weakness instead of applying a -30% penalty to armor, dodge, parry, and block and gains the first hit damage bonus of Exploit Weakness. Dismantling Attack also makes Exploit Weakness no longer expire from the target.
[*]Comprehensive Analysis: New effect, analyze enemy distributes half the stacks of exploit on enemies within 5 tiles. If there are no enemies within 5 tiles those exploits are placed on the main target.
[*]Continuous Analysis: New effect, applies exploits on combat start and on extra turns in addition to at the start of normal turns.
[*]Inflict Despair: Triggers if enemy has exploit and expose weakness -> triggers if enemy has expose weakness.
[*]Joint Offense: Scaling INT/2% -> 2 + INT/2%
[*]Passive Learning: New effect, grants +1 intelligence when an enemy with an exploit dies.
[*]Reactive Study: Doesn't require an exploit to proc (not a change in behavior, in-game tooltip doesn't reflect actual behavior)
[*]Sharpshooter: Scaling every 5 tiles -> every 4 tiles. Works only on single shots -> works on all attacks, but only on the first attack of bursts.
[*]Tide of Excellence: Gains stacks when hitting a target with an exploit -> gains stacks when removing exploits or killing a target with an exploit.
[*]Aeldari Ranger Sight: Doesn't inflict permanent expose weakness, extends the duration of expose weakness by 1 round.
[*]Omnissiah's Providence: Inflict 1 exploit and expose weakness after attacking -> cast exploit weakness on targets before attacking
[/list]
Source can be found at [url=https://github.com/Mawootad/OperativeRework]https://github.com/Mawootad/OperativeRework[/url]

Localizations are not provided on a volunteer basis as I only speak English at a level fluent enough to perform localization. If you would like to contribute missing localizations please feel free to submit a pull request to the GitHub repo. Credits for localization goes to the following contributors:[list]
[*]Russian: Sqwero
[/list]
