Description:
[b]How to Install[/b]
[list=1]
[*]Download the file
[*]Find the Modification folder in \AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\Modifications\
[*]Extract or paste the file into the Modification folder
[*]Add the folder name to the \AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\[i]OwlcatModificationManagerSettins.json[/i] file; it should look like this:[code]  "EnabledModifications": ["OriginsOfTheExpanse"], "ActiveModifications": ["OriginsOfTheExpanse"],[/code]


[*]Start a new game or create a new Companion in an existing save

[/list]You can alzo use [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/146]ModFinder[/url]﻿ for a easier installation.

NOTES: this is a OwlcatModManager mod and requires [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/203]MicroPatches[/url] to load properly.



This mod is an attempt to integrate a handful of new Origins into the game, staying as true as possible to the setting.
Unlike the Homeworlds and Archetypes, the Origins are tied to reactity events. My intention is to complete two/three Origins and afterward try to add reactive dialogue.


[b][size=4]Pariah[/size]

[quote]"A Pariah, also known as a Soulless, Blank, or Untouchable, is a human who possesses a rare mutation that causes them to generate no psychic presence in the Immaterium, leaving them essentially soulless. They are living anathema to psykers, daemons, and creatures of the Warp, with their mere presence painful for both friends and foes alike. All living creatures feel extreme discomfort in their presence, experiencing a natural hostility toward the Blank, generally condemning the Pariah to a brief and lonely life."[/quote]

[/b]Even though it doesn't make much sense for the story of the game — starting from the prologue itself —  you can play as a possessor of the Pariah Gene: a Null is the opposite of a psyker and one of the most powerful mutation in Warhammer.

[list]
[*][b]Psychic Null[/b] - The character is immune to warp damage, psyker spells and perils of the warp.
[/list][list]
[*][b]Anti-Psyker Aura[/b] - The characters adiacent to the Pariah are immune to warp damage, psyker spells, perils of the warp, can't use psyker abilities and deals -100% warp damage. The Pariah lose -5 FEL.
[*][b]Anathema [/b]- Whenever the Pariah character suffers a hit from a daemon, the attacker immediately suffers damage equal to the Pariah's level.
[*][b]Living Anomaly[/b] - At the start of the Pariah's turn, veil degradation is reduced by −2. The Pariah lose -5 FEL.
[*][b]Dampening Aura[/b] - Every character in a 5-cell radius suffers and deals -50% warp damage. They also gains the psy dampening effect [-1 psy rating]. The Pariah lose -5 FEL.
[*][b]Sever the Soul[/b] - Every character hit by the Pariah with a melee weapon suffers Psychosomatic trauma [can't use psyker and navigator spell] for 1 round. The Pariah lose -5 FEL.
[/list] The Origin is fully playable for RT and mercenaries, including a custom set of DarkestHour and MomentOfTriumph. The Talents support an aggressive, melee-oriented playstyle with [b]Sever the Soul[/b] and [b]Anti-Psyker Aura, [/b]and a supportive setup for the non-psyker part of your team with [b]Dampening Aura [/b]and [b][b]Living Anomaly. [/b][/b]

[b]Features Roadmap[/b][list]
[*]Full list of Talents ✔
[*]Available for Mercenaries ✔
[*]Custom DarkestHour/MomentOfTriumph  ✔
[*]Reactivity:  Prologue ✔ | Ch1 ✔ | Ch2✘ | Ch3✘ | Ch4✘ | Ch5✘ | DLC1✘ | Ending Slides ✘
[/list]

Known issues:
﻿Equipping and removing a SynthSkin armor can break the default Origin apparence. The visual can be re-equipped with [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/104]ReDress[/url] until I patch the bug.
﻿Adiacent enemy psykers with the Psychosomatic Trauma will probably disengage. This is good - you mere presence is painful and they should run - but let me know if the AI breaks or some specific fight became too easy.
﻿The Anti-Psyker Aura prevent enemy and friendly unit to cast psyker abilities, and this [i]should [/i]not break the game, but I haven't tested every bossfight and ﻿scripted event. Save often and let me know if something funky happens.



[b][size=4]Augmenticist[/size]

[quote]Augmetic implants are common throughout the Imperium, from prosthetic limbs, life-extending sanguinary actuators, to the mechadendrites of the Adeptus Mechanicus. Most citizens sport some form of bionic modification, but for a select few, bionic modification is more than a mark of status, age, or devotion. For an Augmenticist, bionic enhancement is an obsession.[/quote]

[/b]Cybernetic implants are a vital part of Warhammer 40k...a part that has been denied to us. The Augmentist is an Origin that makes use of all the game’s assets related to Augmentation, aiming to provide new options for different playstyles - except for Psykers. The talents primarily scale with TechUse and are not available right away; some[s] unlock their improved version, while others[/s] have prerequisites such as statistics or levels. Those that [u]modify the character model[/u] are only available upon the selection of [u]Common Talent[/u] and aim to support melee or ranged builds.

[list]
[*][b]Reject the Flesh[/b] (1) - This creature gains +1 deflection, +10% armour, and suffers −5% to dodge.
[/list]There are 4 talents that add an implant to the character model. They are unlocked [u]only[/u] when you can pick a Common Talent (level 5, 9, 14 etc). Each Implant will unlock two other Talents and one Skill:

[list]
[*][b]Mezoa-Pattern Power Limb[/b] - a mechanical right arm that increment STR based on TechUse
[/list][list]
[*][b]Seraphim-Pattern Tactical Limb[/b] - a mechanical left arm that reduce reload costs by -2
[*] | [b]Motive Bolt[/b][b] [/b]- skill, push the enemy away and deals damage
[*] | [b]Burst Protocol[/b] - Rate of Fire based on TechUse
[*] ﻿| [b]Servo-Deflector[/b] - parry with ranged weapons
[*][b]Nomad-XR Kinetic Systems[/b] - mechanical legs, Movement Points based on TechUse
[*] ﻿| [b]Dash Protocol[/b] - skill, a dash based on Tech-Use
[*] | [b]Anti-grav Anchors[/b] - immunity to prone
[*] |﻿ [b]Adaptive Evasion Matrix[/b] - immune to AoO and threatened areas on the first turn
[*][b]Crosshair-VI Targeting Module[/b] - a ocular implant that increase weapons range based on TechUse
[*] ﻿| [b]Auspex Protocol[/b] - skill, target enemy gains exploit based on TechUse
[*] ﻿| [b]Targeting Lens[/b] - extra ctritical hit damage
[*] ﻿| [b]Sentry Protocol[/b] - intelligence intead of perception
[/list]

The Origin in fully playable, with minor placeholder texts and icons. I'll add more Talents and improvements with each patch, but a character created with the first release (v0.8.0) will be fully functional from the start.

[b]Features Roadmap[/b]
[list]
[*]Full list of Talents and Abilities ✘ [i]13/16[/i]
[*]Available for Mercenaries ✔
[*]Custom DarkestHour/MomentOfTriumph  ✘
[*]Reactivity:  Prologue✘ | Ch1 ✔ | Ch2✘ | Ch3✘ | Ch4✘ | Ch5✘ | DLC1✘ | Ending Slides ✘
[/list][b]

FAQ, ISSUES and ﻿[/b][b]FIXES:
- I see only one augmented arm model |[/b] If you have picked [u]both[/u] the arms Talents [u]before v0.8.2[/u], you will see only the last picked arm model. You can fix this permanently with [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/1]ToyBox[/url]﻿: -> open ToyBox with ctrl+F10 -> go to the [i]Search 'n Pick[/i] tab -> write [i]Augmenticist_Talent1_[/i] in the search window -> remove the [i]Augmenticist_Talent1_RArm_Visual[/i] and the [i]Augmenticist_Talent1_LArm_Visual[/i] -> add the[i] Augmenticist_Talent1_BothArm_Visual -> [/i]save the game and reload [i]
- [/i][b]I still see the augments models after a respec[/b]| you can fix this too with the metod above[i], [/i]just remove the corrisponding Arm_Visual object
- [b]I want the mechanical arm without the Talent effect[/b] | pick the corrisponding Arm_Visual with ToyBox, or try [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/104]ReDress[/url]
- [b]Can we have Augmentics Talents for every character without the custom Origin?[/b] | talk to the Hight Factotum, he will open the augmentation bay for your RT





Feel free to use the comments section to suggest to suggest additions and report bugs. Creating an Origin has turned out to be quite a lengthy process, and I don't think I'll go beyond the ones I have planned, but your opinion on balancing and internal changes is extremely valuable

[i]
[/i][i]Thanks to the community on the official Discord server for the help and guidance with this small project.[/i]

Name: Playable X
Author: ADDB
About: Makes the Navigator, Tech-Priest and Adepta Sororitas origins pickeable for your Rogue Trader at Game Start. This might also enable you to recruit multiple Navigators mercenaries.

VersionHistory.Changelog: Fix Cold Trader origin mod breaking custom AdeptaSororitas/DeathCultAssassin/TechPriest

Description:
# Playable X  
Makes the Navigator, Tech Priest and Adepta Sororitas origins pickeable for your Rogue Trader at Game Start.
This might also enable you to recruit multiple Navigator mercenaries.

Changes compared to the previous single versions:

* After character creation finished, it should now automatically disable the option.
* Some people suggested a few things for PlayableTechPriest on Nexus (including Reject the Flesh 1 feature, TechPriestOccupation_Feature and Backpack_techpriest visual). Those should now be added by default.

## Usage  
To use:
  
1. **Before you start the character creation:** Click the button in the PlayableX mod section of the UnityModManager GUI (opened with **CTRL**+F10).
2. Turn the toggle for the wanted origin on on.
3. Now start creating a new character

## Additional Information  
* Because the custom origins don't have any Darkest Hours and Moments of Triumph I've unlocked all of them for the customs.
* I know that Navigator get a Custom Portrait. I've left the Portrait Choices by default since variety is way higher that way. If you want the Navigator one you can just export that one using ToyBox and import it as a Custom Portrait.

Name: Player Gender Override
Author: Microsoftenator
About: While the base game allows you to set your character's voice independently of their body type, your character's gender is determined based on your chosen body type (I = male, II = female). With this mod, you can override this behaviour.

VersionHistory.Changelog:
Fixed toybox compatibility
Handle additional RT-specific text template `{rt_mf|male|female}`

Fixes for new game version
Now should not break toybox's romance gender unlock

Description:
# Player Gender Override (WH40K: Rogue Trader)

While the base game allows you to set your character's voice independently of 
their body type, your character's gender is determined based on your chosen
body type (I = male, II = female).
With this mod, you can override this behaviour.

![image](https://github.com/microsoftenator2022/PlayerGenderOverride/assets/105488202/20c39903-0045-4c12-bf2a-c59ad21402ee)

When active, the game will treat your character as the chosen gender. This
affects:
- Dialogue text (titles, pronouns, etc.)
- Spoken audio (as above)
- Gender-locked quests (romance). These may break if you change gender mid-quest.

Unlike changing your character's gender with eg. Toybox, this does not affect
animations or character model, so those will not break.

In addition, when active, you may optionally override each individual term
(text only).

![image](https://github.com/microsoftenator2022/PlayerGenderOverride/assets/105488202/670905c4-612b-435d-b4e9-be2b7532a916)

All settings are per-save, but this mod should not create a save dependency.

Name: Project BugFix
Author: juliabel
About: Fixed some bugs, added some cut content, made some QoL changes. Any localization can use it.

VersionHistory.Changelog: Big update with many bugs fixed, old and new, see Update12 in Files section
Fixed some new mistakes, updated for Patch 1.4, see Update11 in Files section. Please, update MicroPatches mod to latest (1.18) version too!

Fixed some new and my own mistakes, see Update6 in Files section

Fixed some new and my own mistakes, see Update 3 in Files section
Fixed some new mistakes, see Update3 in Files section

Description:
This is my attempt to clear the game of some nasty long-standing bugs, add content that for some reason wasn't added, and somewhat improve the narrative flow here and there. The total number of changes is more than two hundred, you can get full list in Files section (Patch Notes ENG).
Immediately, an explanation:
a) I don't touch everything about character development and combat - the Owlcats themselves are actively changing this part, and now @ToxicBulb accepted this challenge;
b) everything about the locations is not available in the editor I use.;
c) cutscenes can be repaired in very limited way, since most of their assets are related to b).

Attention! Gaining achievements will be blocked when using mods. To unlock this function use mod [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/1]Toy Box[/url] and check the feature "Allow Achievments While Using Mod" (first page, section ﻿Quality of Life).

Это моя попытка избавить игру от некоторых застарелых багов, добавить контент, который почему-то не добавили, и несколько улучшить подачу нарратива тут и там. Общее число изменений - более двухсот, полный список можно скачать в разделе файлов (Patch Notes RU)
Сразу же пояснение:
a) все, что касается развития персонажей и боевки, я не трогаю - эту часть Совокоты и сами активно меняют, а сейчас и @ToxicBulb aka Картох поднял перчатку;
b) все, что касается устройства локаций, недоступно в редакторе, которым я пользуюсь;
c) катсцены могу чинить в очень ограниченных объемах, поскольку большая часть их содержимого - это то, что относится к пункту b.

Внимание! Использование модов блокирует получение достижений! Для разблокировки необходимо установить мод [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/1]Toy Box[/url] и сделать активным пункт "Allow Achievments While Using Mod" (первая страница, раздел ﻿Quality of Life).

Installation guide:
1. [url=https://github.com/microsoftenator2022/MicroPatches/releases]MicroPatches[/url] - MANDATORY! I'm serious, my mod cant work without brilliant Micro and his hard work. Create a directory MicroPatches in UnityModManager directory (<Users>\<username>\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 4000 Rogue Trader), and unpack archive MicroPatches-Mod with latest release there (MicroPatches-Editor is for modders only).

2. Unpack archive with my mod into Modifications directory (<Users>\<username>\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 4000 Rogue Trader).
3. Create "OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json" file in the <Users>\<username>\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader
4. Open it with notepad and paste { "EnabledModifications": ["Project_BugFix"] } 
OR
2. [url=https://github.com/CasDragon/ModFinder/releases/]Modfinder[/url] - get latest release, unpack it somewhere in your computer, run and put archive with my mod in the section "Drop zip here". 

Updating:
Just unpack new version over Project_BugFix directory in Modifications, when asking about overwrite click Yes.

Special thanks: again, Micro! Almost all my work wouldn't be possible without him. 
And another thanks: Owlcats, their game (and their bugs) are very inspiring :)

Name: Psykers Of The Expanse
Author: OdinThePine
About: Add Telekinesis, Electromancy, Excess psychic disciplines - and some Heretical reactivity

Description:
[b][b][color=#00ff00]How to Install (Easy)[/color]

[/b][/b][list=1]
[*]Download [b][b][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/146]ModFinder[/url]﻿ [/b][/b]
[*]Drag&Drop PsykersOfTheExpanse.zip in Modfinder
[/list][b]
How to Install (Hard)[/b][list=1]
[*]Download the file
[*]Find the Modification folder in \AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\Modifications\
[*]Extract or paste the file into the Modification folder
[*]Add the folder name to the \AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\[i]OwlcatModificationManagerSettins.json[/i] file; it should look like this:[code]  "EnabledModifications": ["PsykersOfTheExpanse"], "ActiveModifications": ["PsykersOfTheExpanse"],[/code]

[*]Start a new game or level up a Psyker in an existing save
[/list]
NOTES: this is a OwlcatModManager mod and requires [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/203]MicroPatches[/url] to load properly.




This mod add new Psyker Disciplines to the lists of Sanctioned and Unsanctioned Psyker.

[color=#cfe2f3]
[/color][b][color=#1e84cc][size=4]Telekinesis [/size][/color][color=#f4f4f4][size=2][i][wip][/i][/size][/color]

[quote]"Telekines wield raw psychic force, manipulating the physical world with their minds.
They can create invisible shields, hurl enemies or crush armor with their sheer will."[/quote][/b]
The Telekinesis discipline does everything a good telekinetic should do: crowd control, push, pull, with a little treat for single-shot and impact weapons.

[list]
[*][b]Assail[/b] - the original Assail from the beta, restored. Ranged AoE damage with the Prone CC
[*][b]Telekinetic Shield[/b] - restored; armor against ranged attacks
[*][b]Grasp[/b] - a new skill with an area grab
[*][b]Force Push[/b] - a new skill that will push away nearby characters, dealing damage
[*][b]Gate to Infinity[/b] - a long-range teleport with a cooldown
[*][b]Void Rend[/b] - a single-target damage skill with a chance of executing the target 
[/list]
Talents
[list]
[*][b]Gravitational Mastery[/b] - the psyker's allies are immune to Grasp and Force Push
[/list][list]
[*][b]Concussion[/b] - Impact damages dealt by the psykers have 10% chance of stun
[*][b]Apply Force [/b]- The first single-shot attack used by the psyker every turn gains +WP Bonus + (3 x Psy Rating) damage and the target suffer -20 dodge chance.
The psyker can use either Willpower or Agility for the Demolition skills, and either Willpower or Strength for the Athletic skills, whichever is higher.[*][b]Reality Ward[/b] - Targets of the Telekinetic Shield ability are immune to the Prone condition and gain +(1+PsyRating) deflection against ranged attacks.
[/list]
[b]Features Roadmap[/b][list]
[*]Full list of 6 Abilities ✔
[*]Available for Mercenaries ✔(?)
[*]Available for Unsanctioned Psykers ✔
[*]Available for Heinrix ✔
[*]Exemplar Psychic Awakening Talent ✔
[*]Full List of 8 Talents ✘ [i]4/8[/i]
[/list]
[b][color=#ffd966][size=4]Electromancer[/size][/color]

[quote]"Whether channeling the deadly storms that shake the Warp or generating bio-lightning from their nervous system, Electromancers are forces to be feared on any battlefield.[/quote][/b]
The Electromancy discipline revolves around Shock damage, the Blinded status, and a custom debuff called Static Charge.

[list]
[*][b]Psybolt[/b] -  [i]The psyker summons a lightning from the Empyrean, dealing 5 + (PsyRating × WillpowerBonus) Shock damage. If the target have stacks of Static Charge this spell hit that many times instead, then all the stacks of Static Charge are removed.[/i]
[/list][list]
[*][b]Warp Storm[/b] -  [i]Everyone within the area takes X to Y Shock damage and is forced to make an Agility resistance test. All targets that fail the test are blinded until the psyker's next turn.[/i]
[*][b]Blinding Light[/b]- E[i]ach enemy in line of sight gains a rank of Static Charge and is forced to make a Fortitude resistance test. All targets that fail the test are blinded until the psyker's next turn and gains PsyRating/2 stacks of Static Charge[/i].
[*][b]Electrokinetic Lash[/b] - a long-range damaging ray
[*][b]Chain Lightning[/b] - [i]Chains up to 4 targets within a 3-cell radius, dealing psy rating × psyker's WillpowerBonus damage to each.[/i]
[*][b]Neural Surge[/b] - [i]T[/i][i]he psyker deals WP Bonus Shock damage to the target ally. At the start of each turn, the damaged ally gains movement points equal to [/i]
[i]their Toughness bonus. The target's melee attacks apply Static Charge[/i][/list]Talents
[list]
[*][b]Thunderstruck[/b] -  [i]Enemies that begin their turn stunned, blinded or with Static Charge stacks within the psyker's line of sight take WP bonus Shock damage[/i].
[*][b]Neural Shield[/b] - [i]The psyker gains +(8 + 8*PsyRating)% additional armour against Shock damage and half this amount as additional armour against energy damage from Exotic and Power weapons.[/i]
[*][b]Stormcaller[/b]-  [i]Whenever the psyker deals Shock damage to a unit, gain a stack. Their attacks and abilities deal +Stacks/3 damage until the end of the combat.[/i]
[*][b]Warpstride[/b] - agility to allies under the effects of psychic powers
[*][b]Battle Sorcerer[/b] - [i]If the psyker's only equipped weapon is a one-handed, non-staff melee weapon, the first time each turn the psyker use a damaging psyker power they can make an extra melee attack with a -15 WeaponSkill malus.[/i] (This Talent will know if you are hiding a Bolter in your secondary weapon slots! You will get the extra melee attack only if the Melee Weapon is the only weapon on your character. [s]This Talent have a hidden compatibility with [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/175]One Handed Staves[/url]﻿ - you can wield a sword/mace/axe in a hand and a Staff in the other hand, Gandalf[/s] [s]Eisenhorn style[/s])
[*][b]Before The Storm[/b] - At the start of combat, inflicts 1+PsyRating/2 Static Charge ranks to every enemy.
[/list]
Buff/Debuff[b]
[/b][list]
[*][b]Static Charge -[/b] Max 5 stacks, -5AGI for each stack
[/list][b]Features Roadmap[/b][list]
[*]Full list of 6 Abilities ✔
[*]Available for Mercenaries ✔
[*]Available for Unsanctioned Psykers ✔
[*]Available for Heinrix ✔
[*]Exemplar Psychic Awakening Talent ✔
[*]Full List of 7 Talents ✘ [i]6/7[/i]
[/list]

[b][color=#ff00ff][size=4]Excess[/size][/color] [/b][b]

[quote]"Excruciating pain. Paralyzing pleasures. Consuming greed, pride, and self-indulgence. Using the warp to bend the body and mind of one's enemies is an unsanctioned practice, for it invites the influence of Chaos into the soul".[/quote][/b]
The Excess discipline is ispired by Slaneesh's domains. It revolves around CC and debuff. It's available to Sanctioned Psykers, but [u]not as a starting discipline[/u].

[list]
[*][b]Pangs of Misery[/b] -  [i]Deals WP Bonus to 3xWP Bonus Neural damage. The target must pass a Willpower resistance test with +Heretic Rank malus. On a failed test, the target suffers a random physical or psychological trauma[/i][i]. [/i][Curated list of debuff in progress]
[/list][list]
[*][b]Allure [/b]-  [i]All enemies that are not immobilized in a 6-cell radius around the Psyker must pass a Willpower resistance test or immediately move 3 cells toward the character. For 1 round the psyker becomes the lowest priority target for enemy attacks.[/i]
[*][b]Sensory Overload[/b]- [i]The psyker flood the target's mind with unbearable pleasure. If the target is a Human with difficulty tier I or II, they must pass a Toughness resistance test with a −(5 + PsyRating x Willpower Bonus) penalty. The target cannot act until the end of their next turn and counts as full cover for the Psyker and their allies when adjacent to that enemy. At the end of their turn, the target suffer (1 + Target FEL Bonus) to (Target's Fellowship Bonus x Target's Fellowship Bonus) mental damage.[/i] [i]If the target passes the test, is not a Human, or has a greater difficulty tier, they onlysuffer the damage immediatly.[/i]
[*][b]The Six Blades of Prosepheron[/b] - [i]This ability can only be used with at least one sword equipped, once per combat. Until the end of combat, the psyker can make +(Heretic Ranks) extra melee attacks during their turn.[/i]
[*][i][b]Tainted Shriek [/b]- single-target warp damage for your noise marine cosplayer[/i]
[*][i][b]Summon: Daemonette[/b] - summons a controllable Daemonette[/i]
[/list]Talents
[list]
[*][b]Sadistic Glee[/b] -  [i]Whenever the psyker deals damage to an ally, the psyker gains +1 Resolve until the end of their turn[/i].
[*][b]The Great Enemy[/b] - Whenever the psyker deals damage to an Eldar or Drukari character, they deals (PsyRating) to (PsyRating x HereticRanks) extra damage.
[*][b]Quest for Perfection [/b]- Keep track of your highest damage ever and earn Momentum when you break your record
[*][b]Blade Trance[/b] - The first use of a Combat Drug each turn cost 0AP. Until the start of the psyker's next turn, they get (3 x Heretic Rank) Perception and each melee attack use Perception instead of Strength when calculating bonus damage
[*][b]Soul Drinker[/b] - lifegain based on Perception when using Force Sword
[*][b]Delightful Agonies[/b] - 2xPerception chance to avoid some types of damage
[/list][b]Features Roadmap[/b][list]
[*]Full list of 6 Abilities ✔ [i]6/6[/i]
[*]Available for Mercenaries ✔
[*]Available for Unsanctioned Psykers ✔
[*]Available for Heinrix ✔
[*]Exemplar Psychic Awakening Talent ✔
[*]Full List of 6 Talents ✔ [i]6/6[/i]
[/list][b][color=#00ff00][size=4]Extras - Reactivity[/size][/color][/b][list]
[*][size=2]The [b][u]Tome of Excess[/u], [/b]the book obtained after a certain battle in Act 2, has been modified. [b]Equipping it[/b] once will unlock a new dialog where you can Destroy it for Dogmatic Convinction Points, or Open it and choose which one of the six aspects of the cult of Slaanesh to follow. You will be rewarded with Heretic Convinction Points, unique Feats, chains of events or something far worse if you fail the skill check.[/size]
[/list][size=2] ﻿ ﻿SPOILER 
﻿After a -35 Wisdom check (-45 for Power), you will gain:[/size][list=1]
[*][size=2]Glory - -a Talent: +2xHeretic Rank to Resolve as long as the Tome Of Excess is equipped.[/size]
[*][size=2]Greed - a small chain of Trading contracts with heretical flavour[/size]
[*][size=2]Sensations - a Talent: 3xHeretic Rank to Perception as long as the ToE is equipped[/size]
[*][size=2]Power -  if you are not a psyker, Psychic Awakening with the Excess discipline; if you are already a psyker, you'll unlock the Excess discipline; if you are already a psyker with the Excess discipline, a Talent: +1PsyRank as long as the ToE is equipped[/size]
[*][size=2]Peace - a Talent, -(Perception Bonus) to WeaponSkill  to enemy in range[/size]
[*][size=2]Lust - a quest. Open the Galactic Map to unlock a clue, then wait for the events to trigger traveling warp routes - 3 parts right now[/size]
[/list]
﻿A failed check will "mark" the RT with a signpost Talent, causing a couple of little reactivity events during the game.[b][size=4]

[/size][/b][list]
[*]A new LV2 Project has been added to Janus for Heretical characters that let Vistenza do her thing, unlocking the missed [b]Tome of Excess[/b] 
[/list][b][size=4]

[/size][/b]

[b][size=3]WIP in priority order[/size][/b]
- Voidfrost
- Other 2 new barely-sanctioned Disciplines for the most Radical psykers inspired by the remaining Chaos Gods
- ..maybe some funky canon and semi-canon disciplines. Blood? Summons? Rage? If only we had infinite time and willpower...



[b][color=#00ff00][b]FAQ, ISSUES and ﻿[/b][/color][b][color=#00ff00]FIXES:[/color]
﻿- I can't see Excess discipline when creating a new character | [/b][/b]That's intended, Santioned Psykers can't start with a radical (heretical?) discipline
[b][b] ﻿- I can't see some text | [/b][/b]If you're playing in english after Lex Imperialis, try deleting and reinstalling the mod. If you are playing in another language, open a Bug post with the missing text, the dlc wiped the localizations and maybe I skipped some parts.
[b] ﻿- Electromancy is too weak | [/b]It is? I'm bad at building. Try building up some Statik ranks with [Blinding Light] and [Before the Storm]. We are balancing it as a team in the comment section, if you have some advices I'll listen
[b][b][b][b] ﻿- [Talent/Skill/Build] is underpowered/overpowered and needs [something] | [/b][/b][/b][/b]As I said, I'm not a pro builder - but maybe you are! Tell me your opinion, if it makes sense it will be implemented
[b][b] ﻿- [Battle Sorcerer] from Electromancy doesn't work | [/b][/b]It's a problematic Talent, but it does work the majority of times. If you found a new bug let me know in the Bugs section.[b][b]
[b][b] ﻿- Can you do a [something] Discipline? | [/b][/b][/b][/b]I’d really love that.Disciplines take a huge amount of time and energy to implement, between visual effects and ideas — that's six skills and eight talents to design and develop. Leave a comment with your idea, it might be so complete or interesting that it becomes a priority.[b][b][b][b]
[/b][/b][b][b][b][b] ﻿- How can I trigger the Excess Quest? |[/b][/b][/b][/b][/b][/b] After reading the Tome of Excess, selecting Lust and winning the skill check, you will gain a Talent. Entering the Galactic Map will unlock a "wisper", a clue. After travelling warp routes a dialogue will trigger - you can indulge in your new vice or repent, interrupting the quest. The second part of the quest will trigger in the same way after reaching Heretical2 and warping around. The event is set at low priority, meaning that [u]Green Routes[/u] are more likely to trigger it. 





Feel free to use the comments section to suggest additional Talents and report bugs. Your opinion and ideas on balancing and internal changes is extremely
valuable.

[i]
[/i][i]Thanks to the community on the official Discord server for the help and guidance with this project.
[i][size=1]I do not own the rights to the images used in the banner. All credit goes to the original artists: Alexey Kruglov, ???, Wonchun Choi, [/size][size=1]Michał Miłkowski, ???, Josu Hernaiz. Non-commercial use[/size][/i]

[/i]

Name: Random Space Battles
Author: jonHinkerton
About: Add space battles to the random events tables for warp travel.

VersionHistory.Changelog: Removed ship damage consequence from skipping battles for people who get an event they are not ready for.

Description:
[This is working for me in with a game started under Micropatches .18, but I am not sure if it is getting patched mid-save yet. We will keep at it until it gets solved, but I am making this visible again in the meantime with this caveat. If you are still not getting these events, check the discussion thread for the .16 workaround.]

Looking for more opportunities to use your flagship? Need a little more variety in your events?

This mod adds space battles to the lists of events which can occur during a warp jump, similar to the shipboard battles with you and your companions. They should come up about as often in each of the three difficulty levels, though red paths will see them more often, as that set only had three events to begin with. Otherwise there is a roughly 10-20% chance of them spawning one of the several events per level*. You will encounter a variety of opponents with challenge ratings that scale with the route difficulty (the orange red route fights are tough**).

* A note on how random warp encounters work - they're not actually random. Well, they're a little random. Each route difficulty has its own event table. Within the table events begin the game with about a 3-5% chance of happening each. The first roll in your save file is a genuine random chance. However, when an event is triggered, that option goes to a 0% chance and every other event gets boosted slightly, and so on for every event you draw. So an event you have seen has a very low chance of recurring, but gets progressively higher and events you have not seen will have the highest likelihood of occurring, eventually becoming almost unavoidable. This type of selection algorithm is good because it eventually gives you every event (probably) and lowers the odds of you getting repeats over fairly long periods (except red routes, red routes only have 5 events even after I added some so they're weird). The thing about this mod is that it injects the new events into the existing table in the middle of that state, so depending how far you are into the game, and how many jumps you made, you may get a run of these then not see them again for a while, or you might  not see them for a fair few jumps at all. The optimal way to use the mod is to add it either at the start of the game or in act 2, but you can add it at any time. It's a bad idea to remove it though. keep a pre-mod save.

** Beware, the battles can be very hard early game. In order to make it easier to avoid them if you aren't ready but still need to take hard routes, I've made the avoid the fight option have no consequences.

Installation:

[b]Important[/b]: You will need to install [url=https://github.com/microsoftenator2022/MicroPatches]MicroPatches[/url] [b]version 1.18 or higher [/b]for this mod to work.

The easiest way to install it would be to use [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/146]Modfinder[/url]﻿.

If not using ModFinder, you will need to unzip the folder into your Game's Modifications folder. The path will be similar to C:\Users\Me\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\Modifications

Once the folder is there, you may need to edit your OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json file. This is one level up from the mod's folder. It needs to look something like:

[code]﻿{"$id":"1","SourceDirectories":[],"EnabledModifications":["jhRandomSpaceBattles ","BigFlagship","jhExpandedArchetypes"],"ActiveModifications":["jhRandomSpaceBattles ","jhExpandedArchetypes"],"DisabledModifications":[]}
[/code]
You will need to add the two entries for jhRandomSpaceBattles following the format above. Once this file is edited you can start your game and you should see the mod in the in-game mod tool (not the built in Unity Mod Manager)

Name: Ravor Find Me A Heretic
Author: jonHinkerton
About: Random encounter generator for retinue and space battles available on demand.

VersionHistory.Changelog: Scaling improvements

Description:
Looking for trouble? Testing a build? Building a mod? Save points are great, but why not just pick a fight?

This mod allows you to visit Master Helmsman Ravor on the bridge and select a new dialog option to trigger a random combat encounter. You can choose either a ship depths fight or a space battle which are similar to those encountered on warp routes.

The voidship depths encounters mix up the pieces of the existing static random encounters, meaning you will find some new combinations of location and opposition to add some variety to your violence.

There is level-based scaling, but expect to be overwhelmed before act 2 and underwhelmed by the end of act 4 until and unless I add some custom enemy groups to fill out the edges.


[b]Installation:[/b]

You will need to install [url=https://github.com/microsoftenator2022/MicroPatches]MicroPatches[/url] [b]version 1.17.4+[/b] for this mod to work.

The easiest way to install it would be to use [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/146]Modfinder[/url]﻿. Download the .zip file and drag it into the Modfinder window or select it from the list.

If not using ModFinder, you will need to unzip the folder into your Game's Modifications folder. The path will be similar to C:\Users\Me\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\Modifications

Once the folder is there, you may need to edit your OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json file. This is one level up from the mod's folder. It needs to look something like:

[code]﻿{"$id":"1","SourceDirectories":[],"EnabledModifications":["jhFindAHeretic"],"ActiveModifications":["jhFindAHeretic"],"DisabledModifications":[]}
[/code]
You will need to add the two entries for jhFindAHeretic following the format above. Once this file is edited you can start your game and you should see the mod in the in-game mod tool (not the built in Unity Mod Manager)

Name: Rechargeable Grenades
Author: Arkive
About: Basic grenades recharge at the end of combat.
Description:
[b][size=3]Description:[/size][/b]
Basic grenades recharge at the end of combat. Currently only affects  fire, frag, krak, and stun grenades.
Download the optional 'RechargeableConsumables' instead to have all consumables recharge at the end of combat. (thanks TKTaKo!)

[b][size=3]Installation:
[/size][/b]
1. Place the unzipped mod folder into:
[i] ﻿%LocalAppData%Low\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\Modifications[/i]
﻿[spoiler][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/5388/images/44/44-1702751189-444734264.jpeg[/img][/spoiler]
2. Activate the mod using either method:
﻿a. Owlcat Modfications Manager
﻿ ﻿1. Browse to your game directory 
﻿ ﻿ ﻿a. For steam: r-click the game in your library -> Manage -> Browse Local Files
﻿ ﻿ ﻿b. For GoG Galaxy: r-click the game in your library -> Manage Installation -> Show Folder
﻿ ﻿2. Open the folders: Modding\Steam Workshop tool\owlcat-modifcations-manager-win32-x64
﻿ ﻿3. Launch owlcat-modifications-manager.exe
﻿ ﻿4. In the left column titled "Installed", check the checkbox by "Rechargable Grenades (X)"
﻿b. Manually
﻿ ﻿Add the mod to:   
[i] ﻿ ﻿%LocalAppData%Low\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json
﻿ ﻿[/i]
﻿ ﻿Example OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json with this mod and toybox enabled:  [spoiler]
[code]{
"SourceDirectories": [
"UnityModManager",
"Modifications"
],
"EnabledModifications": [,
"0ToyBox0",
"RechargableGrenades"
]
}[/code][/spoiler]
3. Verify installation:
1. In the game's main menu, press[b] shift[/b]+[b]f10[/b] to open the the Owlcat Modification UI
﻿2. Rechargeable grenades should appear in the Owlcat Modification UI

[b][size=3]Questions:[/size][/b]
[list]
[*]Can I add/remove this mod to a saved game?
[list]
[*]Short Answer: Yes
[*]Long Answer: This mod uses a blueprint patch for each consumable type changed. This means the blueprint is modified at runtime, so savefiles aren't affected.
[/list][*]Is this mod compatible with X mod?
[list]
[*]Short Answer: Most likely. I haven't found any conflicting mods yet.
[*]Long Answer: If a mod modifies the same consumable fields as this mod, load order will determine the winner.
[/list][/list]

Reduces or removes the negative effects of several consumable combat drugs.

I'm pretty sure I tested all of these, but if I messed something up, leave a comment and I'll fix it when I get the chance.

Requires [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/203]MicroPatches[/url] to install into an existing game.

[*][b]Dark Swiftness: [/b]Does not inflict a penalty to Agility, Strength, or Willpower.

Name: Skill Check Assistant

About: Allows taking (rolling preset value) when doing skill checks. Available options are: roll normally, take 50, take 33, take 25, take 10, take 1. Settings are per individual skill.

VersionHistory.Changelog:
- Additional option to roll check normally if chosen "Take X" is not enough to succeed
- Fix for checks sometimes not being displayed in the log.
Updated for game full release
Support for characteristics checks
Initial release

Description:
# Skill Check Assistant mod for Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader

Allows taking (rolling preset value) when doing skill checks.
Available options are: roll normally, take 50, take 33, take 25, take 10, take 1.
Settings are per individual skill.

By default everything is rolled normally.

### Added in 1.3.0

Option `If chosen "Take X" value is not low enough to succeed, try rolling check normally.`
Default: off   
This is for when you want to take X when X is enough, and try to roll if it's not. For playstyle where you don't want to reload for easy checks, but want to make harder ones a gamble and make use of things that allow rerolling (like Advanced Skill).


## Installation
1. Unpack archive directly into `%userprofile%\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\UnityModManager\` WITHOUT creating additional archive named folder.
2. After running the game, navigate to UMM mod settings (press Ctrl-F10) and set settings as you need.

Resulting structure of already existing UnityModManager folder should be as follows
- `SkillCheckAssistant` (folder)
	- `SkillCheckAssistant.dll`
	- `Info.info`

## How to build (for developers only)
1. Set up RoguePath environment variable to point to game folder
2. Restore nuget packages
3. Clean Solution.
4. Build (note that on build output is automatically copied to installation path).

Name: Tech Priest Overhaul - New Origin - Pasqal Rework
Author: Nekrofancy
About: This mod reworks Pasqal's Tech-Priest origin and is now playable for RT and mercenaries. The rework changes mechadendrites into abilities, and \reworks\combines\introduces\ Tech-Priest talents. This mod also re-adds Pasqal's Forge World Subskin Armour

VersionHistory.Changelog: Initial Release

Description:
[size=3][color=red]IMPORTANT NOTES BEFORE YOU START:[/color][/size] 

1. For an existing playthrough it is highly recommended to respec Pasqal before installing (the same goes to uninstalling the mod).

2. [url=https://github.com/microsoftenator2022/MicroPatches]MicroPatches[/url] is a hard requirement, it is needed for this mod to load properly. (Optional but highly recommended: [b]Give Micro some love[/b]! Things like this mod, and many others mods, would not be possible without him!)

3. It should go without saying for any mod, but especially for a game as long as Rogue Trader, but use at your own risk. Not every interaction in the campaign has been tested so there's always the potential for bugs.

Less Important Note:

There may be some animation funkiness. Specifically, Pasqal has hunched idle animations to show off his back pain. As the rogue trader or mercenary you have no chronic back pain and will stand upright unless holding a really heavy omnissiah axe. For female character models, they're super strong and carry their Omnissiah axe slightly off the ground. Sadly I don't have any ideas of how to fix or change this, if anyone has any ideas as to how to adjust those animations feel free to let me know!

[color=Lawngreen][size=5]Detailed Description/Notes:[/size][/color]

[color=Aquamarine][size=4]Notes on Balance:[/size][/color]
Firstly let me acknowledge that YES, this mod is very likely on the overpowered side of things. I've done my best to keep things reigned in and hopefully nothing stands out as too ridiculous, maybe there are even some things that aren't as strong as they should be. I'm no game designer, and this is a LONG game to try and find sweet spots for keeping things balanced throughout the whole experience, my priority with this mod though was to have lots of interesting options that are ultimately fun and meaningful.

By all means, share with me your thoughts on this kit's balance, whether you think it's too strong/weak, or maybe you're just having a good ol' time, let me know :)

[color=Aquamarine][size=4]Abilities:[/size][/color]
Some of the Tech-Priest's talents were turned into abilities, similar to how Navigator/Psyker (and now Arbitrator) has origin abilities.
Here is a summary of what each of them does, with the specific abilities in the screenshots section of the mod.

[list]
[*][b][u]Manipulator Mechadendrite:[/u][/b]
1AP (1 turn CD) Attack that deals damage, has amour penetration, and a chance to knock the enemy prone[*][b][u]Medicae Mechadendrite:[/u][/b]
1AP (1 turn CD) Ability that heals wounds and fresh injuries. When the tech priest uses medkits on themselves they have a chance to gain Medicae Stockpile that are expended when using this ability to heal traumas and old injuries. Can be used outside combat.[*][b][u]Optical Mechadendrite:[/u][/b]
Gives the Tech-Priest the 'Optical Mechadendrite' (2 turn CD) ability, and a 'Record Observations' (1turn CD) ability. Both cost 0AP'Optical Mechadendrite' marks an enemy which then gains a stack of 'cognition points' for every single target attacks/abilities affecting them.'Record observations' is then used to collect the points from the target onto the tech priest, stacking up to 6 times.When the tech priest attacks with a weapon, if they have 3 or more stacks, they consume those 3 stacks to gain an extra weapon attack for the turn.[*][b][u]Utility Mechadendrite:[/u][/b]
2AP (2 turn CD) ability that creates a zone of incense. While allies are in that zone, they gain several benefits according to what equipment they have (armour type and weapon(s) type)Any enemies that enter the zone make a toughness check or become blinded.[/list]

[color=Aquamarine][size=4]Talents:[/size][/color]
This section covers the specifics of all the talents whether new, changed, or unchanged.

[list]
[*][b]Acceleration Protocol:[/b] +INT Bonus Initiative, (1+INT/3) bonus MP. First weapon attack each round grants (1+INT/3)MP
[*][b]Armor Integration Ports:[/b] Heavy and Power armor proficiency (requires 80 Tech-Use)
[*][b]Augmetic Enlightenment:[/b] Grants 5 Perception, and an additional +1 per tech-priest talent/ability (doesn't include starting talents/abilities)
[*][b]Ballistic Servo Automation:[/b] Ranged weapon attacks don't consume MP
[*][b]Energy Recycling:[/b] First tech priest ability, or power/plasma/metla weapon ability used per round regains 1AP. Regain 2 AP instead with 150+ Tech-Use
[*][b]Exposing Communion:[/b] Attacks and Expose Weakness act as if there were 2 additional stacks of exploits
[*][b]Machine Spirit Scan Protocols:[/b] Weapon attacks apply Machine Spirit Communion (MSC) effect on enemies. MSC also applies 1 exploit on enemies (this includes the attack applying MSC)
[*][b]Overcharge Protocols:[/b] Power, Plasma and melta weapon abilities stack (2xINT Bonus) damage each time they're used. Stacks are visible in buff bar, stack up to 15 times, and 1 stack is removed per turn.
[*][b]Parallel Execution Subroutines:[/b] Second weapon attack from "Dual-Weapon Combat" talent no longer costs extra AP
[*][b]Prediction Protocols:[/b] +(5+INT bonus) Ballistic Skill, +(15+INT bonus)% Dodge reduction with Metlta, Plasma and melee weapons, as well as +(15+INT bonus)% Dodge parry reduction
[*][b]Skirmish Protocols:[/b] +(10+INT bonus) damage and armour penetration with melee attacks while having Machine Spirit Communion (MSC) buff. Enemies under MSC debuff no longer get melee superiority against the tech-priest.
[*][b]Tactical Servo Protocols:[/b] Can fire ranged weapons in melee (Requires Manipulator Mechadendrite ability)
[*][b]Utility Upgrade:[/b] +10 Tech-Use and Logic, and Machine Spirit Communion costs 1AP less.
[/list]

[color=Lawngreen][size=5]What Changed and Why?[/size][/color]

(I don't expect anyone will read this)

Be warned, this section is not for frail organic hearts, there is a lot of [s]rambling[/s] knowledge unsuitable for laymen. Proceed at your own discretion.

[spoiler]

[color=Aquamarine][size=4]Original Talents that changed:
[/size][/color]
This section is just for anyone that might think "Where did X original feature go?" or "Why would you change this?" So I talk a bit about the specific changes and why I made them. My goals were typically to make things more accessible to a hyrbid melee/ranged playstyle, or to fill gaps I felt Pasqal had in his kit (the original plan was not to release it as its own origin, but I guess feature creep got the better of me!)


1. [b][u]Acceleration Protocol:[/u][/b] The upfront MP bonus changed from +INT Bonus to +(1+INT/3) for less extreme scaling. I added +INT Bonus Initiative since Pasqal suffers from low initiative and wants to put points into Intelligence rather than Agility.

The +(INT Bonus/2) MP next round per melee attack I changed into +(1+INT/3)MP for the current round for the first successful attack. Rather than banking movement next round (which often goes wasted once you attack), I made the effect the current turn and also allowed ranged weapons to get the benefit. This lets you more easily reposition after an attack, which further enables the idea of fighting with both ranged and melee weapons.

2. [u][b]Aiming Protocols[/b] and [b]Prediction Protocols[/b][/u] (Combined into Prediction Protocols): Aiming Protocols originally provided +(5+INT Bonus) Ballistic skill, and +(10+INT Bonus) dodge reduction with plasma/melta weapons. Prediction Protocols provided +(15+INT bonus)% Dodge and Parry reduction with melee weapons, with the effect stacking per dodged/parried attack.

I combined these two since a hybrid playstyle requires twice as many features to try and make viable. With these combined you can use it regardless of whether you're focusing pure ranged, pure melee or a mix of both. I removed the stacking effect mostly because the original talent (in vanilla without any mods) doesn't actually work. So I suppose I didn't change anything there, I just didn't fix it.

3. [u][b]Close-Up Scanning[/b] and [b]Machine Spirit Scan Protocols[/b][/u] (Combined into Machine Spirit Scan Protocols: Close-Up scanning originally applied machine spirit communion effect on enemies with Pasqal's melee attacks. Machine Spirit Scan Protocols applied one exploit when applied to enemies.

Originally I had hoped both of these combined would work well together. Turns out it did not make pasqal's melee attacks apply exploits with the combination like I expected it to based on the descriptions. So what I did was combined the two talents, made it apply to both ranged and melee, and added the exploit effect like the description seemed to imply.

In testing, this one might actually be a bit TOO strong, as you can stack tides of  pretty quickly with it, and always have at least +20%ish extra damage with each 'hit' against a target. But let me know what you folks think when you try it. I say, let operatives have a bit of fun, they deserve it! (I also made this skill only show up for operatives since it has to do with exploit

4. [b][u]Filtering Protocols[/u][/b] -> renamed to "Energy Recycling": If you remember way back at release, this would restore 1AP ANY time a plasma or melta skill was used and was extremely OP. Then Owlcat, understandably, nerfed it to once per round. To make it a tad better I extended the effect to not just plasma/melta, but also Power weapons, as well as any tech priest ability. Additionally once your tech use is 150+, you gain 2AP instead of 1, so that you feel rewarded for stacking Tech-Use other than just being a Tech-Use skill monkey.

5. [b][u]Manipulator Push:[/u][/b] Changed into an ability from a talent, see more information in the abilities section further below

6. [b][u]Medicae Mechadendrite:[/u][/b] Same as above, changed into an ability from a talent, see more information in the abilities section further below

7. [b][u]Overcharge Protocols:[/u][/b] Every time Pasqal used Plasma or Melta weapons, damage with those weapons was increased by +(5+INT bonus)% and stacks infinitely. You lost all stacks if you spent a turn without shooting.

One thing to note about how it functions currently in non-modded RT: The tooltip says +(5+INT)% per stack, BUT, the skill behind the scenes is actually stacking +(2xINT Bonus)% per stack which is nuts the higher your Intelligence is. For example, with 150 Intelligence with 10 stacks of overcharge, the tooltip claims it should be 15% per stack for a total of 150% damage. In reality you're getting 30% per stack for 300% damage.

So this is the first talent that I really 'nerf' so to speak, in that I changed the stack limit from 99 to 15. I've updated the description to reflect the damage bonus is +(2xINT bonus)%, I've also included a buff icon so you can see your current stacks. I've extended the effect to include power weapons to help you stack quickly, and cater to that melee/ranged hybrid style. Lastly instead of worrying about losing all stacks for a round without attacking, I've just changed it to lose 1 stack at the  of each turn as your gear 'cools' down so to speak.

This was the one talent I was on the fence about changing, but I figure if you've blasted your way through non-modded tech-priest, hyperstacking overcharge to insane numbers, you're probably looking for a change in playstyle anyway.

8. [b][u]Scanner Mechadendrite[/u][/b] -> Augmetic Enlightenment: Original effect was +10 Perception. Neat. What I did was changed it to 5 Perception +1 for every Tech-Priest talent and ability. This is basically the same effect as Unnatural Allure on Cassia (+5 Fellowship, +1 for every navigator talent/power), except to put it in perspective, Cassia has 19 navigator talents and 15 powers to choose from. This mod gives Tech-Priest 13 (11 if not operative) talents and 5 abilities to choose from.

Also, the Scanner Mechadendrite 'model' itself has been moved to a new ability called "Optical Mechadendrite", see more information in the abilities section further below

9. [b][u]Skirmish Protocols:[/u][/b] Still has original effect of +(10+INT bonus)% damage and armour penetration with melee weapons while under the effects of machine spirit communion. Beyond this I wanted to add a defensive effect that also incentivizes casting machine spirit scan protocols. What I came up with was to have enemies with the debuff not get melee superiority against the tech priest (which was a huge PIA to do from the unity side of things). I'm still a bit iffy on this one, doesn't feel as interesting as I hoped, but let me know what you guys think!

10. [b][u]Utility Mechadendrite[/u][/b] -> Renamed to Utility Upgrade: The original effect was just +10 Tech-Use and Demolition. Firstly, I moved the effect to a new talent called "Utility Upgrade" because the actual Utility Mechadendrite is now an ability. Utility Upgrade also requires the Utility Mechadendrite ability before you can take this talent.

The effect I also changed from +10 Tech-Use and Demotion, to +10 Tech-Use and Logic. Per the original talent's description, the utility mechadendrite is equipped with tools to communicate with machine spirits. So Logic instead of Demolition seems more appropriate for dealing with machine spirits which are essentially 'code' driven entities. Along those lines I also added the effect to this talent that decreases Machine Spirit Communion cost by 1AP since that would be useful while sticking with the theme.

[color=Aquamarine][size=4]New Talents:[/size][/color]

This is a list of brand new talents that I added to hopefully help fill some gaps in the kit, or the ranged/melee hyrbid style of play

1. [b][u]Armour Integration Ports:[/u][/b] Gives Heavy and Power Armour Proficencies, requiring 80 Tech-Use. If you wanted to run heavy or power armour Pasqal, you have to go VERY far out of your way to get him the Heavy Armour strength requirements. But tech-priests shouldn't need raw strength, they simply need the technical know-how to get and use stronger augmetics.

The talent giving both heavy and power armour is mostly because I find it annoying you have to get both separately. Once you finally get power armour you either have to respec, or suffer the pain of having wasted a talent on a proficiency you won't use anymore (maybe that's intentional by design, but I just don't like it!)

2. [b][u]Ballistic Servo Automation:[/u][/b] Allows the Tech-Priest to make ranged weapon attacks without ending movement. This one might be quite strong as an origin talent, but I mean...the Tech-Priest has a whole ballistic servo arm, why should they need to worry about stopping to aim when they shoot? Right?

But more importantly, this helps with dual weapon combat so that when you fire a ranged attack, you're not stuck without a good way to get in close to then get your secondary melee attack.

3. [b][u]Parallel Execution Subroutines:[/u][/b] The second weapon attack from Dual-Weapon Combat talent no longer costs extra AP. Not much to say here, just a nice way to conserve AP if going all in on dual weapon combat style. The original plan was to also remove the WS/BS penalties to the secondary attack like Dual-Weapon Specialist does but...Fun fact: Dual-Weapon Specialist LIES! It SAYS it removes the penalty, but I've seen behind the curtain O_O it does no such thing!

4. [b][u]Tactical Servo protocols:[/u][/b] The Tech-Priest can fire their ranged weapon while in melee. This is for the opposite situation as to Ballistic Servo Automation, if you find yourself doing a melee attack and then want to dual weapon use a ranged, you're trapped in melee so you need to be able to fire while in melee. This talent is dependent on the manipulator mechadendrite ability with the idea that an extra arm would help give you the space needed to fire a ranged weapon while in the thick of it.

[color=Aquamarine][size=4]Abilities:[/size][/color]

All of the 4 mechadendrites were turned into origin abilities. I liked the idea other origins had of adding universal abilities to any career choice. Sometimes on Pasqal I didn't feel like any particular operator, or overseer ability is all that useful for the build. This gives you more options to choose from so you don't feel like you have a 'dead' pick on an ability level up.

An additional note about the mechadendrite abillities, all of them include the character mechadendrite models when taken, similar to the talents. Also corrected it so that if you respec it (SHOULD) properly removes those mechadendrites if you don't have that ability anymore. (May have mixed results if you play with the mechadendrite settings through toybox or redress)

1. [b][u]Manipulator Mechadendrite[/u][/b] (Originally was the Manipulator Push Feature): The only things that changed about the manipulator push ability is that it is now 1AP instead of 2AP (2AP for this ability was ridiculous), and instead of a push it's a scaling skill check to knock the enemy prone.

I prefer the prone rather than push mostly because it can be rough trying to chase down a target you just pushed away. Also the DC check for enemies falling prone from push is a mystery to me, so I went with something that's a bit more clear. (If you know how the prone DC check on push mechanics works, I'd love to know!)

2. [b][u]Medicae Mechadendrite[/u][/b] (Was originally a talent): The original ability only healed wounds during combat, and was a whopping 2AP. This ability didn't make much sense to me when compared with Invigorate that was 1AP, healed for more, and also healed debuffs and could be used out of combat to clear fresh wounds.

What I changed was made it 1AP instead of 2, allow it to heal all fresh injuries and then wanted to make a way to turn regular medikits into a way to heal traumas (especially since traumas are a problem without good solutions in Act 1 and beginning of act 2). The idea is that the tech-priest can use medikits to stock up on meidcae supplies for their mechadendrite that can then be used to heal traumas and old injuries. The efficiency of this abillity scales with Medicae skill level.

Even with all this, I'm not 100% sold on this ability, I'm thinking it may need some kind of debuff removal, but it's difficult for me to add that without it becoming even more wordy than it already is. (I have a problem with making wordy abilities it seems!)

3. [b][u]Optical Mechadendrite:[/u][/b] The model for this mechadendrite was originally the scanner mechadendrite. One of the things Pasqal struggles with in particular is number of attacks per turn, so I wanted to add an interesting way for him to be able to get an extra weapon attack. If you've never played Mechanicus, it had a system where you collected Cognition Points from enemies and tech in the environment, and you spent those cognition points on attacks. I wanted to make this skill somewhat of a 'nod' to that mechanic, but not quite as simple as JUST collecting the points. The idea is you mark a target, see how they react to various external forces and effects, and then collect that data and leverage it against them.

The optical mechadendrite having a 2 turn cooldown is so that you're not necessarily guaranteed an extra weapon attack every round. If you plan a good turn and take the time to collect the max data (6 stacks), then you're set for an extra attack this round and the next. Collect data has a 1 turn cooldown instead of 2 in case you want to wait a turn before collecting the cognition points.

If you've made it this far in the notes, here's a tip...for some reason expose weakness applies like 3 stacks of cognition points instead of 1. Don't know why, probably won't try to fix that, so use it to your benefit :)

4. [b][u]Utility mechadendrite:[/u][/b] Was originally a talent, made it into a new ability, moving the talent stats to 'Utility Upgrade'. So apparently utility mechadendrites have electrically powered censors that can puff incense fumes, used both for working with machines/machine spirits as well as offensively to blind enemies. I figured I wanted an ability that is more on the support side of things, so made it into a zone of incense that can bless ally equipment. I wanted the effects to complement the individual weapon and armour types in interesting way, so hopefull I've accomplished that! Let me know what you think of this one.

5. [b][u]Refractor Field:[/u][/b] Technically not a mechadendrite, but when browsing through FX I saw some cool force field stuff that I wanted to use. So the ability itself sounds quite strong, and I imagine if you get to 10+ stacks when using it, you might feel it's a bit OP (not sure yet!). What I will say, is that lots of enemies use burst attacks, and it doesn't matter if it's a 1 damage hit, or a 100 damage hit, one stack is always removed. The abiilty is also 2AP, so you dedicate a lot of your turn to use it. To make a comparison, late game "Endure" from warrior absorbs both ranged and melee damage, and with high enough armour the number of attacks it can absorb will likely be higher other than an occasional large hit here or there.
[/list]
Anyway, same as all the other abilities, let me know what you think!

That's it! If by some miracle of the Omnissiah you made it this far into the description, you truly have the blessed mind of a Tech-Priest. May your canticles always compile without error, your litanies avoid the 404th message, and most of all, may the cycle be discontinued!

[/spoiler]


Thank you to all the folks who have helped me and answered my many dumb layman questions in the modding channel of the Owlcat Discord!
[size=1]I do not own the rights to the art used in the main mod image of Opticon-22. The specific copyrights are specified in the bottom right corner of the image. The picture was created by the wonderful artist Vladimir Kafanov, check him out![/size]

Name: Tier 1 Archetypes in Tier 2
Author: jonHinkerton
About: Makes the tier 1 archetypes available in tier 2.

VersionHistory.Changelog: Added Medicae to tier 2 for those using the mod
Compatibility with new expanded archetypes features.
Fix for game version 1.4
Now functions as a compatibility patch bridging itself, Expanded Archetypes, and the Medicae Archetype mods.

Description:
Ever wanted to play a soldier officer? an operative warrior? Why not?

This mod makes the core 4 tier 1 archetypes (Operative, Officer, Soldier, Warrior) available in tier 2 using the expanded 20 level format for that tier, giving you many more build combinations to explore.

This mod also includes the settings needed to bridge this mod with [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/177]Expanded Archetypes [/url]and [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/208]Medicae[/url], allowing these mods to provide their benefits to each other.


[b]Installation:[/b]

You will need to install [url=https://github.com/microsoftenator2022/MicroPatches]MicroPatches[/url] [b]version 1.17.6+[/b] for this mod to work.

The easiest way to install it would be to use [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/146]Modfinder[/url]﻿. Download the .zip file and drag it into the Modfinder window or select it from the list.

If not using ModFinder, you will need to unzip the folder into your Game's Modifications folder. The path will be similar to C:\Users\Me\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\Modifications

Once the folder is there, you may need to edit your OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json file. This is one level up from the mod's folder. It needs to look something like:

[code]﻿{"$id":"1","SourceDirectories":[],"EnabledModifications":["jhT1T2"],"ActiveModifications":["jhT1T2"],"DisabledModifications":[]}
[/code]
You will need to add the two entries for jhT1T2 following the format above. Once this file is edited you can start your game and you should see the mod in the in-game mod tool (not the built in Unity Mod Manager)

Name: ToyBox (a bag of tricks)
Author: Narria
About: Toy Box is a cute and playful mod with 400+ cheats, tweaks and quality of life improvements. It was created in the spirit of Bag of Tricks & Cheat Menu but with a little different focus.

VersionHistory.Changelog:
### Toybox Rogue - Ver 1.7.20 (built for 1.4.1.217)

* (***ADDB***) Fix ToyBox breaking Owlmods in weird/random ways when it loads blueprints. (This is considered a major issue so previous versions will be marked as incompatible)

### Toybox Rogue - Ver 1.7.16 (built for 1.4.0.185)

* (***ADDB***) Probably fixed issue where ToyBox could cause a "Unable to change equipment in combat" warning.

### Toybox Rogue - Ver 1.7.15 (built for 1.4.0.184)

* (***ADDB***) Added Bag of Tricks => Quality of Life feature to play DLC1 main menu theme again.
* (***ADDB***) DLC2 Fixes: Stuff related to the following things changed: some dialog features; stuff related to shields; Party Editor for pets
* (***ADDB***) Allow adding flat and percent boosts to enemy stats (at the bottom of Bag of Tricks); e.g. Enemy Health Multiplier
* (***ADDB***) Reset level now works in Party Tab
* (***ADDB***) Fix Skip Splash Screen
* (***ADDB***) Prevent log spam
* (***ADDB***) PatchTool: Fix rare UI crash
* (***ADDB***) PatchTool: Auto-Generate Components and Elements. ***Those need (unique) names or it could cause problems*** (e.g. in rare cases it can prevent saving). I still suggest creating your own name! This is merely a fix to stop some accidental issues
* (***ADDB***) PatchTool: Now ignore whether the element type of an array or generic constraint is abstract or an interface; e.g. properly allowing instantiation of Condition[].
* (***ADDB***) PatchTool: Now restrict new list elements to the type of the actual list object, not the field type. This could previously cause issues where the patch failed.
* (***ADDB***) PatchTool: Introduced Dangerous Patches
* (***ADDB***) PatchTool: Fixed some bugs related to Unity Objects
* (***ADDB***) PatchTool: Apply Patches later so that it runs after most content mods.

### ToyBox Rogue - Ver 1.7.13 built for Rogue Trader 1.3.1.11

* (***ADDB***) PatchTool: List elements now properly show all their fields instead of only the fields of the list type
* (***ADDB***) PatchTool: Properly track Element-types created via field Instantiation
* (***ADDB***) PatchTool: Fix collections filled with null elements breaking ui
* (***ADDB***) PatchTool: Catch error when target blueprint is missing (e.g. due to mod changes)
* (***ADDB***) PatchTool: Support sbyte
* (***ADDB***) Apply performance Transpilers only once. Whoopsie.

### ToyBox Rogue - Ver 1.7.12 built for Rogue Trader 1.3.1.11

* (***ADDB***) PatchTool: Fix regression which broke enum patches
* (***ADDB***) PatchTool: Properly deserialize nested operations with the custom converter

### ToyBox Rogue - Ver 1.7.11 built for Rogue Trader 1.3.1.11
* (***ADDB***) PatchTool: Finish implementing patch versioning (I forgot)

### ToyBox Rogue - Ver 1.7.10 built for Rogue Trader 1.3.1.11

* (***ADDB***) PatchTool: Make patch .json files better readable by serializing enums as strings and adding a No-Op when enums are unused.
* (***ADDB***) PatchTool: Show failed patches in the list as actually failed.
* (***ADDB***) PatchTool: Various Patcher optimizations, which very vastly improved initial load time for patches.
* (***ADDB***) PatchTool: Make it possible to indirectly modify localization of things by allowing changing of keys under LocalizedString => Shared => LocalizedString
* (***ADDB***) PatchTool: Prevent broken Blueprint references from crashing the UI.
* (***ADDB***) PatchTool: Prevent internal ToString exception from crashing the UI.
* (***ADDB***) Prevent CompanionInParty.CheckCondition patch from causing exceptions on game load by no longer getting companion state of disposed units

Description:
# ToyBox

### Install & Setup (Rogue)

1. Download the ToyBox mod file and unzip
1. If the folder is not already named 0ToyBox0 please rename it to that
1. Launch the game at least once.
1. **Please note that the game comes with its own built in Unity Mod Manager so you do not need to install another one**
1. Navigate to %userprofile%\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\UnityModManager\
1. An example path is C:\Users\PC\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\UnityModManager\
1. Copy 0ToyBox0 into the UnityModManagerFolder
1. Launch Rogue Trader and you may need to hit ctrl+F10 to see the mod manager window
1. Load a save or start a new game to get the most out of of the mod

* Warning: ToyBox for Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader is a complex mod. Save early and often.
* Note: If you find non-functioning features, please report them.

### Usage
Here is a summarized list of features. This list only includes a part of the features contained in the mod.

-  **Bag of Tricks**: 
    * Allow both male and female RTs to romance Heinrix and Cassia
    * Allow Remote Companions to join into dialog
    * Modify Faction Reputation, Navigator's Insight, Scrap and more
    * Experience Multiplier
    * Dice Roll Cheats/Options
    * Enable Achievements with Mods installed
- **Level Up**: Make Respec start from Level 0 for you and Companions
- **Party Editor**: Modify your own conviction and/or stats or features or portraits or voices of party members or Respec Characters for free
- **Colonies**: Modify different Colony Resources
- **Search 'n Pick**: this lets you search through various available things (items, feats, abilities, unity and locations) and spawn/give/summon them
  and manipulate your game state in an almost limitless set of ways. You can add/remove items, feats, abilities,
  etc. You can spawn any unit. You can start/unstart/complete etudes, quests, etc. You can teleport to any area in the
  game. It is almost unimaginable how much you can do in here so keep digging!
- **Etudes**: this is a new and exciting feature that allows you to see for the first time the structure and some basic
  relationships of Etudes and other Elements that control the progression of your game story. Etudes are hierarchical in
  structure and additionally contain a set of Elements that can both conditions to check and actions to execute when the
  etude is started. As you browe you will notice there is a disclosure triangle next to the name which will show the
  children of the Etude. Etudes that have Elements will offer a second disclosure triangle next to the status that will
  show them to you.
  WARNING: this tool can both miraculously fix your broken progression or it can break it even further. Save and back up
  your save before using. Remember that "with great power comes great responsibility"
- **Quest Resolution**: this allows you to view your active quests and advance them as needed to work around bugs or
  skip quests you don't want to do. Be warned this may break your game progression if used carelessly.

# How to contribute
- Make sure you have Visual Studio 22 (or current) installed and other tools you might want.  See [WotR Modding Beginners Guide](https://github.com/WittleWolfie/OwlcatModdingWiki/wiki/Beginner-Guide) for more info
- on the [main repository page](https://github.com/cabarius/ToyBox) click on "fork" in the upper-right corner
![alt text](./documentation-assets/github-fork.jpg "github fork button position")
- on your personal fork of the repository clone to your computer ([multiple method avaiable, chose the one you prefeer](https://docs.github.com/en/repositories/creating-and-managing-repositories/cloning-a-repository))
![alt text](./documentation-assets/github-clone-1.jpg "github code button position")
![alt text](./documentation-assets/github-clone-2.jpg "github code button preview")
- create a branch in your fork with a short description of your contribution (e.g. `git checkout -b my-contribution-descriptor`)

![alt text](./documentation-assets/github-new-branch.jpg "git checkout -b example")
- do your magic with the code
- push to your fork
- open a pull-request from your fork to the main repository

# Development Setup
1. Install ToyBox mod into your game via Unity Mod Manager
1. Clone the git repo
1. Build the solution twice and restart Visual Studio
1. Now you can just change things and build the solution and it will automatically build and install into the mod folder in the game
1. **Important** If you are adding a feature or fixing a bug please add a release note entry to the *ReadMe.md*.  This is how we tell our the world about your great work^_^
    1. Find the highest release name near the top. It will look something like `### Ver 1.3.7 (Coming Soon)`. 
    1. Usually it is 0.0.1 higher than the current release but please check on Nexus.  If not please add a new Version entry at the top for the next release using proper markdown. 
    1. Don't worry too much about getting this right as Narria Cabarius will clean this up on merge so when in doubt add a new version.
    1. format your release note like like this:
    >```* (Jane/JoeCoolCollaborator) added a Coolness Multiplier in Bag of Tricks that makes your main character that much more awesome!```

**PS**: 

Learn to mod Owlcat Games (Kingmaker and Wrath of the Righteous) [here](https://github.com/spacehamster/OwlcatModdingWiki/wiki/Beginner-Guide)
        
[Join our discord](https://discord.gg/owlcat) and go to #mod-dev-technical and #mod-user-general meet the mod authors: **Narria** and her kind collaborators **ArcaneTrixter**, **Aphelion (SonicZentropy)**, **Delth** and others.  We love to chat about modding and teaching others to mod.

Name: Unlock Blood Phial
Author: jonHinkerton
About: Unlock's Kibellah's first quick slot.
Description:
Pretty straightforward mod, it unlocks the Blood Phial grenade in Kibellah's first quick slot so you can choose to put something else there.


[b]Installation:[/b]

You will need to install [url=https://github.com/microsoftenator2022/MicroPatches]MicroPatches[/url] [b]version 1.17.4+[/b] for this mod to work.

The easiest way to install it would be to use [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/146]Modfinder[/url]﻿.

If not using ModFinder, you will need to unzip the folder into your Game's Modifications folder. The path will be similar to C:\Users\Me\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\Modifications

Once the folder is there, you may need to edit your OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json file. This is one level up from the mod's folder. It needs to look something like:

[code]﻿{"$id":"1","SourceDirectories":[],"EnabledModifications":["jhUnlockPhial"],"ActiveModifications":["jhUnlockPhial"],"DisabledModifications":[]}
[/code]
You will need to add the two entries for jhUnlockPhial following the format above. Once this file is edited you can start your game and you should see the mod in the in-game mod tool (not the built in Unity Mod Manager)
